original: thar pa ni yol bas bsgribs pa tsam ste /

analyzed: lus zhig na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshong dpon de la blo skyes pa bdag gi bu sde snod gsum @184b dang ldan pa /

analyzed: chos sgrogs pa /

analyzed: yang bsams pa /

analyzed: bdag nyid la rtsom par byed pa ni sdug bsngal ba yin na /

analyzed: de'i phyir bdag srog dang bral bar byed nus pa su yod snyam nas /

original: tshong dpon des bsams pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon des bsams pa /

analyzed: skyong ma 'di ni sbom mo glen ma dman pa yin pas 'dis bdag srog dang bral bar byed nus kyis /

original: gzhan gyis ni mi nus snyam mo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni mi nus snyam mo //
translated: No one else can.”

original: tshong dpon de'i khyim dang ha cang thag mi ring ba zhig na /
analyzed: tshong dpon de'i khyim dang ha cang thag mi ring ba zhig na /
translated: Not far from the merchant’s house,

original: khyim bdag cig gi bus bag ma blangs pa der /
analyzed: khyim bdag cig gi bus bag ma blangs pa der /
translated: a householder’s son had taken a bride.

original: tshong dpon de'i chung ma bran mo mngag gzhug ma skyong ma dang bcas shing mgron du bos te song ngo //
analyzed: tshong dpon de'i chung ma bran mo mngag gzhug ma skyong ma dang bcas shing mgron du bos te song ngo //

analyzed: bag ma blangs pa dang / ston mo zin nas /

analyzed: tshong dpon gyi chung mas skyong ma la smras pa /

analyzed: skyong ma khyod song la tshong dpon gnyid log par mi 'gyur bar srung shig /

original: kho mo yang phyi bzhin 'ong ngo //
analyzed: kho mo yang phyi bzhin 'ong ngo //
translated: I will follow you.”

original: skyong mas jo mo'i tshig mnyan te /
analyzed: skyong mas jo mo'i tshig mnyan te /
translated: The nurse listened to the lady’s words,

original: khyim du song nas tshong dpon gyi drung du phyin pa dang / tshong dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim du song nas tshong dpon gyi drung du phyin pa dang / tshong dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: went home, and went into the presence of the merchant. The merchant said,

analyzed: skyong ma khyod ga las 'dir 'ongs /
translated: “Nurse, where have you come from?”

original: skyong mas smras pa /
analyzed: skyong mas smras pa /

analyzed: rje'i sras khyim bdag che ge mo'i bus bag ma blangs pa de bdag gis bltas te 'tshal ma 'tshal nas mchis so //
translated: “Master, I went to see the bride who was taken by the son of such-and-such a householder, and I have returned after eating and drinking.”

original: skyong ma bag ma len pa bzang ngam /
analyzed: skyong ma bag ma len pa bzang ngam /
translated: “Nurse, was the bride-taking good?”

original: rje'i @185a *// sras bzang ngo //
analyzed: rje'i @185a *// sras bzang ngo //
translated: “Master, it was good.”

original: gal te ngas khyod de ltar bag mar gtang bar bya na khyod dga'am /
analyzed: gal te ngas khyod de ltar bag mar gtang bar bya na khyod dga'am /
translated: “If I were to give you in marriage like that, would you be happy?”

original: rje'i sras dga'o //
analyzed: rje'i sras dga'o //
translated: “Master, I would be happy.”

original: gal te de na kho bo ci zer ba de bzhin du byed na /
analyzed: gal te de na kho bo ci zer ba de bzhin du byed na /
translated: “If you do what I say,

original: kho bo khyod dga' bar 'gyur ba shes so //
analyzed: kho bo khyod dga' bar 'gyur ba shes so //
translated: I know you will be happy.”

original: skyong mas smras pa /
analyzed: skyong mas smras pa /
translated: The nurse said,

original: rje'i sras de bzhin du bgyi'o //
analyzed: rje'i sras de bzhin du bgyi'o //
translated: “Master, I will do it that way.”

original: skyong ma gal te de lta na kho bo'i ltor mi ma yin pa zhig zhugs kyis de sod cig /
analyzed: skyong ma gal te de lta na kho bo'i ltor mi ma yin pa zhig zhugs kyis de sod cig /

original: rje'i sras go rims ji ltar bgyi /
analyzed: rje'i sras go rims ji ltar bgyi /
translated: “What is the order of the prince’s sons?”

original: skyong ma dang por nga'i rkang pa gnyis tshir cig /
analyzed: skyong ma dang por nga'i rkang pa gnyis tshir cig /
translated: “First, nurse, you must squeeze my two feet.”

analyzed: de'i 'og tu byin pa gnyis / de'i 'og tu pus mo gnyis /
translated: “After that, my two buttocks.”🔽“After that, my two knees.”

original: de'i 'og tu brla gnyis /🔽de'i 'og tu rked pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brla gnyis / de'i 'og tu rked pa /
translated: “After that, my two thighs.”🔽“After that, my waist.”

original: de'i 'og tu lto ba /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lto ba /
translated: “After that, my belly.”

original: de'i 'og tu brang /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brang /
translated: “After that, my chest.”

original: de'i 'og tu gre bar tshir la gal te kho bo mgul na ma btang zhig /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gre bar tshir la gal te kho bo mgul na ma btang zhig /
translated: “After that, my throat. Don’t let me die with my neck stuck.”

analyzed: skyong ma glen ma des de bzhin du byas te des dam du btsir ba dang / tshong dpon gyis bsams pa /
translated: The foolish nurse did as she was told. She squeezed him tightly, and the merchant thought,

original: kye ma'o bdag skyong ma 'dis btang yang ci ma rung snyam na /
analyzed: kye ma'o bdag skyong ma 'dis btang yang ci ma rung snyam na /
translated: “Alas! It would be good if this nurse would let me go.”

original: skyong mas de bas kyang ches dam du btsir to //
analyzed: skyong mas de bas kyang ches dam du btsir to //
translated: But the nurse squeezed him even tighter.

original: lhas tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
analyzed: lhas tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
translated: The god spoke a verse:

original: blo ngan gyis ni gang 'dzin pa //
analyzed: blo ngan gyis ni gang 'dzin pa //
translated: “Whatever is grasped by a foolish mind

original: rus sbal gyis ni gang 'dzin bzhin //
analyzed: rus sbal gyis ni gang 'dzin bzhin //
translated: is like what is grasped by a turtle.

original: skyong mas zin par gyur pas na //
analyzed: skyong mas zin par gyur pas na //
translated: Since you are grasped by a nurse,

original: khyod ni 'tsho bar ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: khyod ni 'tsho bar ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see that you will live.”

original: tshong dpon de dus la bab nas //
analyzed: tshong dpon de dus la bab nas //
translated: When the time came for the merchant to die,

original: skyong mas ras kyis g-yogs te bzhag go /
analyzed: skyong mas ras kyis g-yogs te bzhag go /
translated: The nurse covered him with a cloth and left him there.

original: de nas tshong dpon gyi chung ma phyi bzhin 'ongs nas de smras pa /
analyzed: de nas tshong dpon gyi chung ma phyi bzhin 'ongs nas de smras pa /
translated: Then the merchant’s wife came out and said,🔽‘Nurse, did you put the merchant to bed while you were sitting here?’ The merchant’s wife tried to wake the merchant,

original: skyong ma khyod 'dug bzhin du tshong dpon nyal du bcug gam zhes tshong dpon gyi chung ma des tshong dpon bslang bar brtsams pa dang / @185b skyong mas smras pa /
analyzed: skyong ma khyod 'dug bzhin du tshong dpon nyal du bcug gam zhes tshong dpon gyi chung ma des tshong dpon bslang bar brtsams pa dang / @185b skyong mas smras pa /
translated: but the nurse said,

analyzed: ngan bus 'di'i lto na dgra bo mchis pa phyung bas /
translated: ‘While you were sitting here, a son of a bitch pulled out an enemy from inside his belly.

original: des na 'di nyal bar gyur gyis 'di ma bslangs shig /
analyzed: des na 'di nyal bar gyur gyis 'di ma bslangs shig /
translated: That’s why he’s lying down. Don’t wake him up.’

original: tshong dpon gyi chung mas bsams pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi chung mas bsams pa /
translated: The merchant’s wife thought,

original: 'di'i dgra bo ci 'dra ba zhig yin pa de blta'o snyam nas /
analyzed: 'di'i dgra bo ci 'dra ba zhig yin pa de blta'o snyam nas /
translated: ‘I’ll see what kind of enemy this is.’

original: des brtag par brtsams pa dang / dus la bab pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des brtag par brtsams pa dang / dus la bab pa mthong ngo //
translated: She began to examine him and saw that the time had come.

original: tshong dpon gyi chung ma de la blo skyes pa /
analyzed: tshong dpon gyi chung ma de la blo skyes pa /
translated: The merchant’s wife thought,

original: 'di ni skyong ma'i spobs pa ma yin gyi 'di ni bu zan mo'i bu sde snod gsum dang ldan pa de'i spobs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyong ma'i spobs pa ma yin gyi 'di ni bu zan mo'i bu sde snod gsum dang ldan pa de'i spobs pa yin te /
translated: ‘This is not the nurse’s confidence. This is the confidence of the son of the nurse’s son, who is a master of the Tripiṭaka.

analyzed: des sde snod gsum bklags na chos gzhan 'ga' yang bstan pa ma byas par yab khyod kyis mi dgyes par mi bgyi ste /
translated: Father, you should not be displeased.

original: khyod yul gzhan du song na lo legs shing mtho ris ni dar gyis chod pa tsam /
analyzed: khyod yul gzhan du song na lo legs shing mtho ris ni dar gyis chod pa tsam /
translated: If you go to another country, the harvest will be good and the heavens will be as clear as a silk cloth.

original: thar pa ni yol bas bsgribs pa tsam ste /
analyzed: thar pa ni yol bas bsgribs pa tsam ste /
translated: Liberation will be as if covered by a curtain.

original: lus zhig na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pas /
analyzed: lus zhig na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pas /
translated: Even if your body is destroyed, you will be reborn among the gods.”

original: da ni 'di'i lus kyang zhig /
analyzed: da ni 'di'i lus kyang zhig /
translated: “Now his body is destroyed.

original: lha rnams kyi nang du yang skyes zin gyis khyod tshur shog /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi nang du yang skyes zin gyis khyod tshur shog /
translated: He has already been reborn among the gods. Come here.

original: kho mo dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod cig /
analyzed: kho mo dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod cig /
translated: Enjoy yourself with me.

original: khyim gyi bya ba yang rjes su sgrubs shig /
analyzed: khyim gyi bya ba yang rjes su sgrubs shig /
translated: Also, carry on the work of the house.”

original: ces chung ma sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pa nges tshig tu brjod nas /
analyzed: ces chung ma sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen pa nges tshig tu brjod nas /
translated: Having spoken these words of distress to her husband,

original: de'i 'og tu gos sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dag gis khyogs brgyan nas mnyan yod kyi phyi rol gyi dur khrod du bsregs te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gos sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang dkar po dag gis khyogs brgyan nas mnyan yod kyi phyi rol gyi dur khrod du bsregs te /
translated: she then decorated the bier with blue, yellow, red, and white cloth and cremated him in the charnel ground outside Śrāvastī.

original: de nas mya ngan bsangs pa byas te 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas mya ngan bsangs pa byas te 'dug go /
translated: Then he consoled his mother and sat down.

original: chung ma de bar bar du yang de skad sha stag zer bas dge slong sde snod gsum pa des bdag gi pha dus la bab par thos nas /
analyzed: chung ma de bar bar du yang de skad sha stag zer bas dge slong sde snod gsum pa des bdag gi pha dus la bab par thos nas /
translated: “ ‘The bhikṣu who was an expert on the Tripiṭaka heard that his father had passed away.

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: 'di ni 'dus byas rnams @186a *//
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas rnams @186a *//
translated: “This is the nature of conditioned things,

original: kyi chos nyid yin mod kyi 'on kyang ma yar mo de'i mya ngan bsang ba byar 'gro'o snyam nas /
analyzed: kyi chos nyid yin mod kyi 'on kyang ma yar mo de'i mya ngan bsang ba byar 'gro'o snyam nas /
translated: but still I will go to console my mother.’

original: de song ba dang / ma yar mo des thag ring po kho na nas dge slong de mthong ngo //
analyzed: de song ba dang / ma yar mo des thag ring po kho na nas dge slong de mthong ngo //
translated: “ ‘When the mother saw the bhikṣu from a distance,

original: mthong nas kyang yang bu zan mo'i bu sde snod gsum dang ldan pas sde snod gsum bklags na chos gzhan 'ga' yang bstan pa ma byas par yab khyod kyis mi dgyes par mi bgyi ste /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang yang bu zan mo'i bu sde snod gsum dang ldan pas sde snod gsum bklags na chos gzhan 'ga' yang bstan pa ma byas par yab khyod kyis mi dgyes par mi bgyi ste /
translated: she said, “My son, the son of a widow, you are an expert on the Tripiṭaka. You have recited the Tripiṭaka, but you have not taught any other Dharma. You should not displease your father.

original: khyod yul gzhan du song na lo legs shing mtho ris ni dar gyis chod pa tsam /
analyzed: khyod yul gzhan du song na lo legs shing mtho ris ni dar gyis chod pa tsam /
translated: If you go to another country, the prosperity of the heavens will be as if covered by a canopy,

original: thar pa ni yol bas bsgribs pa tsam ste /
analyzed: thar pa ni yol bas bsgribs pa tsam ste /
translated: and liberation will be as if covered by a curtain.

original: lus zhig na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pas da ni 'di'i lus kyang zhig /
analyzed: lus zhig na yang lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pas da ni 'di'i lus kyang zhig /
translated: When his body disintegrates, he will be reborn among the gods.”

original: lha rnams kyi nang du yang skyes zin gyis khyod tshur shog kho mo dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod cig /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi nang du yang skyes zin gyis khyod tshur shog kho mo dang lhan cig dga' mgur spyod cig /
translated: “Now his body has disintegrated, and he has been reborn among the gods. Come here and enjoy yourself with me.🔽And continue to do your work at home.”

original: khyim gyi bya ba yang rjes su sgrubs shig ces smra bar brtsams pa dang / dge slong de nyam nga nas de nyid nas phyir log go /
analyzed: khyim gyi bya ba yang rjes su sgrubs shig ces smra bar brtsams pa dang / dge slong de nyam nga nas de nyid nas phyir log go /
translated: The monk, feeling embarrassed, turned back right there.

original: de bdag gis 'chir bcug par ma gyur tam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes nas /
analyzed: de bdag gis 'chir bcug par ma gyur tam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes nas /
translated: “I hope I didn’t cause him to die,” he thought, and he felt regret.

original: des skabs de dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
analyzed: des skabs de dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
translated: He told the monks what had happened,

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the monks told the Blessed One, who said,

original: dge slong dag dge slong de la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong de la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: “Monks, that monk has committed no offense.

original: yang dge slong gis nad pa la gang thos na nad pa 'chi bar sems pa de 'dra ba'i chos bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gis nad pa la gang thos na nad pa 'chi bar sems pa de 'dra ba'i chos bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: “Monks, a monk should not teach the Dharma to a sick person in such a way that the sick person thinks, ‘Because of this teaching, I will die.’

original: dge slong gis nad pa la gang thos na nad pa 'chi bar sems pa de 'dra ba'i chos ston par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gis nad pa la gang thos na nad pa 'chi bar sems pa de 'dra ba'i chos ston par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk teaches the Dharma to a sick person in such a way that the sick person thinks, “I will die,” he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 'di yang re zhig @186b byung ba yin gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di yang re zhig @186b byung ba yin gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar ni mi mdzad do //
translated: This is a temporary measure, but the Blessed Buddha, the Lord, does not lay down a training rule for his disciples, the monks.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das spong byed dag na chu klung yid 'ong ldan gyi 'gram na sgron shing gi tshal gseb na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das spong byed dag na chu klung yid 'ong ldan gyi 'gram na sgron shing gi tshal gseb na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha, the Lord, was staying in the Vindhyas, on the banks of the river Yāmuna, in the forest of Aṭavī.

original: de na bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun la /
analyzed: de na bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun la /
translated: There the Blessed One said to the community of monks:

original: dge slong dag mi sdug pa sgoms shig /
analyzed: dge slong dag mi sdug pa sgoms shig /
translated: “Monks, cultivate the meditation on foulness.

original: mi sdug pa bsten cing goms par byas /
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsten cing goms par byas /
translated: When you rely on and cultivate the meditation on foulness,

original: lan mang du byas na 'bras bu chen po dang phan yon chen por 'gyur ro zhes mi sdug pa ston par mdzad cing mi sdug pa sgom pa'i bsngags pa brjod par yang mdzad do; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag mi sdug ba sgoms shig /
analyzed: lan mang du byas na 'bras bu chen po dang phan yon chen por 'gyur ro zhes mi sdug pa ston par mdzad cing mi sdug pa sgom pa'i bsngags pa brjod par yang mdzad do; ;bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag mi sdug ba sgoms shig /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, meditate on the unattractive.

original: mi sdug pa bsten cing goms par byas /
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsten cing goms par byas /
translated: If you rely on the unattractive, cultivate it,🔽and do it many times, it will have great results and great benefits.”

original: lan mang du byas na 'bras bu chen po dang phan yon chen por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas de'i tshe na dge slong dag mi sdug pa sgom par byed de /
analyzed: lan mang du byas na 'bras bu chen po dang phan yon chen por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas de'i tshe na dge slong dag mi sdug pa sgom par byed de /
translated: When he said this, the monks meditated on the unattractive.

original: de dag mi sdug pa sgom par byed pa de'i tshe /🔽rnag gi lus 'dis sgyid lug pa dang / mus byung ba dang / the tshom za ba dang / smod par byed pa na mtshon yang 'byin par byed /
analyzed: de dag mi sdug pa sgom par byed pa de'i tshe / rnag gi lus 'dis sgyid lug pa dang / mus byung ba dang / the tshom za ba dang / smod par byed pa na mtshon yang 'byin par byed /
translated: When they meditated on the unattractive,

original: dug kyang za bar byed /
analyzed: dug kyang za bar byed /

translated: I have not attained complete nirvana, so bring me to complete nirvana.’

original: de nas ri dvags zlog dge sbyong sbed kyi dge slong de srog dang bral bar bgyis te /
analyzed: de nas ri dvags zlog dge sbyong sbed kyi dge slong de srog dang bral bar bgyis te /
translated: “Then the ascetic Udraka Rāmaputra killed that monk.

original: de bzhin du gnyis dang gsum nas dge slong drug cu'i bar dag srog dang bral bar bgyis pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis dang gsum nas dge slong drug cu'i bar dag srog dang bral bar bgyis pas /
translated: In the same way, I killed two, three, up to sixty monks.

original: btsun pa gang gis da ltar dge slong dag nyung ngur gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa gang gis da ltar dge slong dag nyung ngur gyur /
translated: Venerable One, that is the cause and condition for the present decrease in the number of monks,

original: nyams par gyur /
analyzed: nyams par gyur /
translated: their decline,

original: rnga rdor gyur cing dge slong gi dge 'dun srabs par gyur pa'i rgyu ni de lags /🔽rkyen ni de lags so //
analyzed: rnga rdor gyur cing dge slong gi dge 'dun srabs par gyur pa'i rgyu ni de lags / rkyen ni de lags so //
translated: and the thinning of the Saṅgha of monks.”

original: kun dga' bo dge slong yang dge slong la rtsol ba byed dam /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong yang dge slong la rtsol ba byed dam /
translated: “Ānanda, do monks quarrel with monks?”

original: btsun pa rtsol bar bgyid do //
analyzed: btsun pa rtsol bar bgyid do //
translated: “Venerable One, they do.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa /🔽rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge sbyong gi tshul ma yin pa / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, criticized them, saying, “It is not suitable, it is not proper,🔽it is not worthy of a renunciant, it is not allowable, it is not to be done.

original: rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes smad do //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa tshul dang mthun pa ma yin pa de ni rab tu byung bas bya ba ma yin no zhes smad do //
translated: Renunciants should not do such things.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam grangs du mas rnam par smad nas /
translated: Then, after criticizing them in many ways,

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Buddha told the monks:

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na phan yon bcu yang dag par gzigs pas 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar bya ste /
translated: Monks, since I have seen these ten benefits, I establish the bases of training for my disciples in the vinaya.

original: 'di lta ste dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun legs par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gnong mi bkur ba'i gang zag rnams tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir dang / ngo tsha shes pa rnams bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge 'dun bsdu ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun legs par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gnong mi bkur ba'i gang zag rnams tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir dang / ngo tsha shes pa rnams bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: They are: to gather the saṅgha, to act well for the saṅgha, to abide in comfort in the saṅgha, to suppress individuals who are not ashamed to do evil, to enable those who are ashamed to do evil to abide in comfort,

original: mngon par ma dad pa rnams mngon par dad par bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon par dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung bar bya @190a *//
analyzed: mngon par ma dad pa rnams mngon par dad par bya ba'i phyir dang / mngon par dad pa rnams phyir zhing 'byung bar bya @190a *//
translated: to cause those who have not generated faith to generate faith, to increase the faith of those who have generated faith,🔽to cause those who have not entered the doctrine to enter it, to cause those who have entered it to be trained, and to cause those who have been trained to be liberated.

original: ba'i phyir dang / tshe 'di'i zag pa rnams bsdam par bya ba'i phyir dang / tshe rabs phyi ma'i rnams bzlog par bya ba'i phyir dang / nga'i tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan pa yangs par gyur pa lha dang mi'i bar dag la yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i phyir dang / tshe 'di'i zag pa rnams bsdam par bya ba'i phyir dang / tshe rabs phyi ma'i rnams bzlog par bya ba'i phyir dang / nga'i tshangs par spyod pa skye bo mang po la phan pa yangs par gyur pa lha dang mi'i bar dag la yang dag par rab tu bstan pa yun ring du gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: in order to restrain the defilements of this life, in order to avert those of future lives, and in order that my pure conduct may endure long, for the benefit of many, for the happiness of many, in order to compassion for the world, for the sake of the great multitude, for the sake of gods and men.

original: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /
translated: “My disciples, you should recite this rule of training:

original: yang dge slong gang mi'am mir chags pa la bsams bzhin du rang gi lag bdar te srog bcad dam /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang mi'am mir chags pa la bsams bzhin du rang gi lag bdar te srog bcad dam /
translated: ‘If a monk intentionally deprives an human being or one commited to being human of life,

original: de la mtshon byin nam /🔽de la mtshon thogs pa gnyer tam /🔽de 'chir bcug gam /
analyzed: de la mtshon byin nam / de la mtshon thogs pa gnyer tam / de 'chir bcug gam /
translated: or if he gives him a weapon,🔽or if he praises death to him,🔽or if he acts as an accomplice to death,

original: de la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod kyang rung ste /
translated: or if he praises dying to him, saying,

original: de la 'di skad ces kye mi khyed 'tsho ba sdig pa mi gtsang ba ngan pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces kye mi khyed 'tsho ba sdig pa mi gtsang ba ngan pa 'dis ci zhig bya /
translated: “Hey, you, what’s the point of living a life of bad, impure, and vile actions?

original: kye mi khyod gson pa bas shi bla'o zhes zer zhing sems kyi 'dod pa dang / sems kyi kun tu rtog pa dag gis rnam grangs du mas de 'chir bcug gam /
analyzed: kye mi khyod gson pa bas shi bla'o zhes zer zhing sems kyi 'dod pa dang / sems kyi kun tu rtog pa dag gis rnam grangs du mas de 'chir bcug gam /
translated: and he encourages him to die in many ways, with statements of his own wishes and thoughts, and with statements of what he has heard.

original: de la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod de /
analyzed: de la 'chi ba'i bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: He praises death to him, saying,🔽“Hey, you! You’d be better off dead than alive!”

original: de'ang rtsom pa des dus byas na dge slong de'ang pham par gyur pa yin gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang rtsom pa des dus byas na dge slong de'ang pham par gyur pa yin gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: If that monk dies because of that action, then that monk too is defeated, and he should not stay on.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for ‘monk’:

original: dge slong rnam pa bzhi po ming gi dge slong dang / khas 'che ba'i dge slong dang / slong ba'i phyir dge slong dang / nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong las /
analyzed: dge slong rnam pa bzhi po ming gi dge slong dang / khas 'che ba'i dge slong dang / slong ba'i phyir dge slong dang / nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong las /
translated: There are four kinds of monks: the nominal monk, the monk by claim, the monk by begging for alms, and the monk by the destruction of the pollutants.

original: ming gi dge slong gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming gi dge slong gang zhe na /
translated: As for the nominal monk:

original: gang gi ming dang ming du brjod pa dang / tshig gnyis pa dang / tshig bla dvags dang / 'du shes dang / bod pa dang / gdags pa dang tha snyad @190b dge slong zhe'am /
analyzed: gang gi ming dang ming du brjod pa dang / tshig gnyis pa dang / tshig bla dvags dang / 'du shes dang / bod pa dang / gdags pa dang tha snyad @190b dge slong zhe'am /
translated: He is called a monk by name, by what is said, by the second word, by the superlative word, by perception, by designation, by convention, as a monk,

original: dge slong gi rigs she'am dge slong dang 'dra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba de ni ming gi dge slong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi rigs she'am dge slong dang 'dra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba de ni ming gi dge slong zhes bya'o //
translated: The monk who is a mere name is the one who is called a monk by way of a name, but who is not a monk in reality.

original: khas 'che ba'i dge slong gang zhe na /
analyzed: khas 'che ba'i dge slong gang zhe na /
translated: What is a monk by claim?

original: gang dge slong ma yin bzhin du bdag nyid dge slong ngo zhes khas 'che bar byed pa dang / rku thabs su gnas shing dge slong du dam 'cha' bar byed pa de ni khas 'che ba'i dge slong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dge slong ma yin bzhin du bdag nyid dge slong ngo zhes khas 'che bar byed pa dang / rku thabs su gnas shing dge slong du dam 'cha' bar byed pa de ni khas 'che ba'i dge slong zhes bya'o //
translated: The monk by claim is the one who is not a monk, but who claims to be a monk, and who lives by theft, having taken the vow of a monk.

original: slong ba'i phyir dge slong gang zhe na /
analyzed: slong ba'i phyir dge slong gang zhe na /
translated: What is a monk by begging?

original: gang chos dang ldan pas slong mo spyod pas 'tsho bar byed pa de ni slong ba'i phyir dge slong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang chos dang ldan pas slong mo spyod pas 'tsho bar byed pa de ni slong ba'i phyir dge slong zhes bya'o //
translated: The monk by begging is the one who lives by begging in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong gang zhe na /
translated: What is a monk by destruction of the impurities?

original: gang gi zag pa kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa yang srid par byed par rims nad dang bcas pa rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba phyi ma la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag spangs pa dang /
analyzed: gang gi zag pa kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa yang srid par byed par rims nad dang bcas pa rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba phyi ma la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bar 'gyur ba gang dag yin pa de dag spangs pa dang /
translated: completely understood, cut off at the root, made a mere stump that can make no further growth, and transformed so that it will not arise in the future, those defilements that cause the defilements, create further existence, are accompanied by fever, have painful results, and lead to birth, old age, and death in the future.

original: yongs su shes pa dang / rtsa ba nas bcad pa dang / shing t'a la'i mgo bzhin du gzhi mi snang ba dang / phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa de ni nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / rtsa ba nas bcad pa dang / shing t'a la'i mgo bzhin du gzhi mi snang ba dang / phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos can du gyur pa de ni nyon mongs pa bcom pa'i phyir dge slong zhes bya'o //
translated: He is a monk because he has destroyed the defilements.

original: don 'dir ni gsol ba dang gzhi'i las mi g-yo ba bzhag par mi 'os pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa gang yi pa de dge slong du dgongs te /
analyzed: don 'dir ni gsol ba dang gzhi'i las mi g-yo ba bzhag par mi 'os pas bsnyen par rdzogs pa gang yi pa de dge slong du dgongs te /
translated: In this context, the one who is fully ordained is considered a monk, because it is not appropriate for him to be moved from the basis of the proposal and the fundamental actions.

original: des na yang dge slong gang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na yang dge slong gang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “Whatever monk.”

original: mi 'am zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi 'am zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Human” means

original: gang gis ma'i ltor dbang po drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gis ma'i ltor dbang po drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: one who has entered the mother’s womb with these six sense faculties.

original: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po thob par gyur pa'o //🔽mir chags @191a *//
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang / rna ba'i dbang po dang / sna'i dbang po dang / lce'i dbang po dang / lus kyi dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po thob par gyur pa'o // mir chags @191a *//
translated: the eye faculty, the ear faculty, the nose faculty, the tongue faculty, the body faculty, and the mind faculty.

original: pa la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pa la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In a human existence” means🔽in a human birth.

original: gang gis ma'i ltor dbang po gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gis ma'i ltor dbang po gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: “In whom three faculties” means

analyzed: lus kyi dbang po dang / tshor ba'i dbang po dang / yid kyi dbang po thob par gyur pa la'o //
translated: in whom the body faculty, the sensation faculty, and the mind faculty have appeared.

original: bsams bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa nas so //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par brtags pa nas so //
translated: “Intentionally” means having reflected on it.

original: rang gi lag dar te zhes bya ba ni lag pas lag dar te'o //
analyzed: rang gi lag dar te zhes bya ba ni lag pas lag dar te'o //
translated: “With one’s own hand” means with one’s own hand.

original: srog bcad dam zhes bya ba ni de'i srog bcad par gyur na'o //
analyzed: srog bcad dam zhes bya ba ni de'i srog bcad par gyur na'o //
translated: “Having killed” means having taken away their life.

original: de la mtshon byin nam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mtshon byin nam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having given a weapon to that person” means

original: ral gri'am spu gri'am chu gri'o //
analyzed: ral gri'am spu gri'am chu gri'o //
translated: a sword, a knife, or a razor.

original: de la mtshon thogs pa gnyer tam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mtshon thogs pa gnyer tam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Having sought out an executioner” means

original: skyes pa'am / bud med dam /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / bud med dam /
translated: a man, a woman, or

original: ma ning ngo //
analyzed: ma ning ngo //
translated: a neuter.

original: de 'chir bcug gam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de 'chir bcug gam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “To cause them to die” means

original: 'chir gzhug pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'chir gzhug pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: to cause death in three ways:

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / nad pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / nad pa'o //
translated: to cause a moral person to die, to cause an immoral person to die, and to cause a sick person to die.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How does one cause an immoral person to die?

original: 'di ltar dge slong tshul khrims 'chal ba la lhung bzed dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong tshul khrims 'chal ba la lhung bzed dam /
translated: If a monk who is immoral obtains a begging bowl,

original: chos gos sam /🔽dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
analyzed: chos gos sam / dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
translated: a Dharma robe,🔽a water strainer,

original: ska rags sam /
analyzed: ska rags sam /
translated: a water pot,

original: dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba cung zhig rag lus pa na /
analyzed: dge slong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba cung zhig rag lus pa na /
translated: or any other requisite for a monk’s livelihood,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: he thinks,

original: ji srid du tshe dang ldan pa 'di gson pa de srid du bdag gis thob par mi 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: ji srid du tshe dang ldan pa 'di gson pa de srid du bdag gis thob par mi 'gyur gyis /
translated: “As long as this venerable one lives, I will not obtain anything.

original: bdag de'i drung du song la 'chir gzhug go snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag de'i drung du song la 'chir gzhug go snyam nas /
translated: I will go to him and cause him to die.”

original: de de'i drung du song ste 'di skad ces /
analyzed: de de'i drung du song ste 'di skad ces /
translated: He goes to him and says,🔽“Venerable one, you are immoral.

original: tshe dang ldan pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba sdig pa'i chos can lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang ldan pa ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang ldan pa yin pas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba sdig pa'i chos can lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang ldan pa ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang ldan pa yin pas /
translated: “Venerable, you are immoral, you have bad qualities, you are physically, verbally, and mentally immoral.

original: tshe dang ldan pa ji srid yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur ba de srid du bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ji srid yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur ba de srid du bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Venerable, as long as you live, you will increase your nonvirtue.

original: @191b bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel na yun ring du sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: @191b bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel na yun ring du sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes smras pa na /
translated: If you increase your nonvirtue, you will be reborn in the hells for a long time.”

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba de dge slong de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa 'o na kho bos ji ltar bya zhes zer ba'i tshe /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba de dge slong de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa 'o na kho bos ji ltar bya zhes zer ba'i tshe /
translated: When the immoral monk said to the monk, “Venerable, what should I do?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog khyod kyis bdag nyid thong zhig /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog khyod kyis bdag nyid thong zhig /
translated: the monk said, “Come here, venerable. You should kill yourself.

original: bdag nyid sod cig /
analyzed: bdag nyid sod cig /
translated: You should kill yourself.

original: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du chug cig ces smras na /
analyzed: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du chug cig ces smras na /
translated: You should deprive yourself of life.”

original: gal te tshul khrims 'chal ba de bdag nyid gtong bar byed dam /
analyzed: gal te tshul khrims 'chal ba de bdag nyid gtong bar byed dam /
translated: If the immoral monk himself gives up his life,

original: bdag nyid gsod pa byed dam /
analyzed: bdag nyid gsod pa byed dam /
translated: or if he kills himself,

original: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du 'jug na dge slong de pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du 'jug na dge slong de pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he causes himself to lose his life, then that monk has committed an offense entailing expulsion.

original: gal te tshul khrims 'chal ba de 'di snyam du de ltar yin no snyam mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te tshul khrims 'chal ba de 'di snyam du de ltar yin no snyam mod kyi /
translated: If the immoral monk thinks, “That’s the way it is,”

original: 'on kyang 'di skad ces kho bo bdag nyid mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di skad ces kho bo bdag nyid mi gtong ngo //
translated: but says, “I won’t give up my life,

original: kho bo bdag nyid mi gsod do //
analyzed: kho bo bdag nyid mi gsod do //
translated: I won’t kill myself,

original: kho bo bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du mi 'jud do zhes zer zhing gal te de bdag nyid gtong bar mi byed /
analyzed: kho bo bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du mi 'jud do zhes zer zhing gal te de bdag nyid gtong bar mi byed /
translated: I won’t cause myself to lose my life,” and if he doesn’t give up his life,

original: bdag nyid gsod par mi byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid gsod par mi byed /
translated: doesn’t kill himself,

original: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du mi 'jud na /🔽dge slong de la sbyor ba snga ma de nyid kyis nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed du mi 'jud na / dge slong de la sbyor ba snga ma de nyid kyis nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: and doesn’t cause himself to lose his life,🔽then he commits an offense entailing suspension for the initial action.

original: gal te dge slong de de skad smras nas 'gyod par gyur cing de tshul khrims 'chal ba de'i gan du song ste /
analyzed: gal te dge slong de de skad smras nas 'gyod par gyur cing de tshul khrims 'chal ba de'i gan du song ste /
translated: If that monk, after saying that, feels remorse and goes to that immoral monk,

original: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa shes par gyis shig /
analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa shes par gyis shig /
translated: “Venerable, you should know that

original: 'di lta ste byis pa blun pa /
analyzed: 'di lta ste byis pa blun pa /
translated: this is like a foolish,

original: mi gsal ba /
analyzed: mi gsal ba /
translated: unclear,🔽unskilled person who speaks words thoughtlessly,

original: mi mkhas pa dag gis te bor gya tshom dang / byung rgyal gyis so sor ma brtags par tshig smras te /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa dag gis te bor gya tshom dang / byung rgyal gyis so sor ma brtags par tshig smras te /
translated: rashly, and without analysis.

original: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'ga' zhig mgu bar byas na /🔽des lus kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa @192a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'ga' zhig mgu bar byas na / des lus kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su ma dag pa @192a *//
translated: In this way, Venerable, if you please a spiritual friend,

analyzed: las phyung nas bdag cag tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yid du 'ong ba dang bral bar gyur cing bdag cag la pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba ma byung ngam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes par gyur to zhes zer ba'i skabs de /
translated: “We have been separated from our attractive companions in the celibate life. Have we committed a downfall that would be a defeat?”

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag khyed la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: “Monks, you have not committed a downfall.

original: yang dge slong rnams kyis so phag 'phang bar mi bya bar 'di ltar lag pas lag par brgyud bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong rnams kyis so phag 'phang bar mi bya bar 'di ltar lag pas lag par brgyud bar bya'o //
translated: “Monks, you should not build a wall of bricks. You should pass your hands from hand to hand.

original: gal te bye ba'am /
analyzed: gal te bye ba'am /
translated: If it is cracked

original: gas pa yin na go bar bya ste brgyud @206b par bya'o //
analyzed: gas pa yin na go bar bya ste brgyud @206b par bya'o //
translated: or broken, you should make it understood and then pass it from hand to hand.

original: go bar ma byas par brgyud par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go bar ma byas par brgyud par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you pass it from hand to hand without making it understood, a breach occurs.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyis mkhar lan gyi stongs mo bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams kyis mkhar lan gyi stongs mo bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, you should build a wall of bricks.”

original: dge slong rnams nyi ma rangs par las byed nas bram ze dang khyim bdag dag ci'i phyir dge slong 'di dag nyi ma rangs par gla mi bzhin du las byed ces 'phya bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong rnams nyi ma rangs par las byed nas bram ze dang khyim bdag dag ci'i phyir dge slong 'di dag nyi ma rangs par gla mi bzhin du las byed ces 'phya bar byed /
translated: They disparaged them,

original: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
analyzed: phyar ka gtong bar byed /
translated: and spread it about.

original: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kha zer bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported the matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: nyi ma rangs par las mi bya bar 'di ltar lan cig bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma rangs par las mi bya bar 'di ltar lan cig bya'o //
translated: “You should not work all day. You should work like this.”

original: dge slong dag so ga phyi dro las byed la /
analyzed: dge slong dag so ga phyi dro las byed la /
translated: The monks worked in the afternoon in the spring.🔽They worked in the morning in the winter.

original: dgun ni snga dro las byed nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dgun ni snga dro las byed nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: so ga ni snga dro las bya ba la /
analyzed: so ga ni snga dro las bya ba la /
translated: “In the spring, you should work in the morning.

original: dgun ni phyi dro las bya'o //
analyzed: dgun ni phyi dro las bya'o //
translated: In the winter, you should work in the afternoon.”

original: de dag dus rting la thug pa na gtong zhing 'jim rdzab kyis gos pa'i lus kyis de bzhin rings pa rings par bsod snyoms la 'jug pa na ma dad pa dag 'phags pa dag khyed cag gis gla mi dag kyang pham par byas te /
analyzed: de dag dus rting la thug pa na gtong zhing 'jim rdzab kyis gos pa'i lus kyis de bzhin rings pa rings par bsod snyoms la 'jug pa na ma dad pa dag 'phags pa dag khyed cag gis gla mi dag kyang pham par byas te /
translated: The non-Buddhists ridiculed them, saying, “Noble ones, you have defeated even your servants.🔽They have abandoned the time for eating, but you do not abandon the time for eating.”

original: de dag kyang zas kyi dus yongs su spong bar byed na khyed cag zas kyi dus kyang spong bar mi byed do zhes co 'dri bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dag kyang zas kyi dus yongs su spong bar byed na khyed cag zas kyi dus kyang spong bar mi byed do zhes co 'dri bar byed pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this matter to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: bsod snyoms pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis ni sta gon byas nas /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa gang dag yin pa de dag gis ni sta gon byas nas /
translated: “Those who are alms-goers should prepare and🔽then enter the village for alms.

original: grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug khom pa dang / gang dag dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa dbang ba de dag gis ni sta gon byas nas /
analyzed: grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug khom pa dang / gang dag dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa dbang ba de dag gis ni sta gon byas nas /
translated: Those who are entitled to the Saṅgha’s gains should prepare and

original: dge 'dun gyi dbus su 'jug khom pa @207a *//
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi dbus su 'jug khom pa @207a *//
translated: then enter the midst of the Saṅgha.

original: de ltar dus shes par byas te gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus shes par byas te gtang bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, the time should be known and then left.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sta gon byas nas grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug par bya zhing dge 'dun gyi dbus su yang 'jug par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sta gon byas nas grong du bsod snyoms la 'jug par bya zhing dge 'dun gyi dbus su yang 'jug par bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Having prepared, you should enter the village for alms and also enter the midst of the Saṅgha.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis ji tsam gyis na sta gon byas par brjod par bya ba mi shes nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis ji tsam gyis na sta gon byas par brjod par bya ba mi shes nas /
translated: The monks did not know how much to say about the preparation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ji tsam gyis lag pa gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis bkrus pa dang / lhung bzed bkrus par gyur pa de tsam gyis na sta gon byas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis lag pa gnyis dang / rkang pa gnyis bkrus pa dang / lhung bzed bkrus par gyur pa de tsam gyis na sta gon byas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: “To the extent that you wash your two hands and two feet and wash your alms bowl, to that extent you should say that you have prepared.”

original: gzhan yang ngas dge slong mkhar lan byed pa dag gis kun du spyod pa'i chos dag bca' bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngas dge slong mkhar lan byed pa dag gis kun du spyod pa'i chos dag bca' bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, I will lay down the rules for the conduct of monks who are in charge of the monastery.

original: dge slong mkhar lan byed pas dus ji lta ba bzhin du snga dro ni khye'u sus dag sbyor du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mkhar lan byed pas dus ji lta ba bzhin du snga dro ni khye'u sus dag sbyor du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Monks who are in charge of the monastery should have the morning meal prepared at the appropriate time.

original: phyi dro ni skom dang lag pa dang rkang pa'i bsku mnye rgyu dag sbyor du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi dro ni skom dang lag pa dang rkang pa'i bsku mnye rgyu dag sbyor du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: In the afternoon, they should have drinks, hand massages, and foot massages prepared.

original: dge slong mkhar lan byed pas kun du spyod pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa dag yang dag par blangs te 'jug par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong mkhar lan byed pas kun du spyod pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa dag yang dag par blangs te 'jug par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk does not properly undertake and engage in the rules of conduct as prescribed, he becomes guilty of an offense.

original: 'brog gnas su bsod snyoms pas bsro khang byed du bcug pa ji lta ba bzhin du me khang gi gleng gzhi yang de kho na bzhin du rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'brog gnas su bsod snyoms pas bsro khang byed du bcug pa ji lta ba bzhin du me khang gi gleng gzhi yang de kho na bzhin du rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The story of Āṭavika is to be told in detail in the same way as the story of the bathhouse.

original: bye brag ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: bye brag ni 'di yod de /
translated: The difference is this.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi ma zin pa la mkhar lan gyi stongs mo bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi ma zin pa la mkhar lan gyi stongs mo bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “In the case of an unfinished foundation, a monk may do the work of a mason.”🔽Some monks were working on a bathhouse, hiding the bricks here and there.

original: dge slong dag me khang gi las byed cing pham dag phar sbed tshur sbed pa na de dag gi 'og na shing mkhan zhig zhal ta byed de /
analyzed: dge slong dag me khang gi las byed cing pham dag phar sbed tshur sbed pa na de dag gi 'og na shing mkhan zhig zhal ta byed de /
translated: A carpenter was in charge of the work.

original: @207b ji tsam na phyam dag sbed pa na /
analyzed: @207b ji tsam na phyam dag sbed pa na /
translated: When they were hiding the bricks,

original: dge slong gi lag nas phyam shor bas shing mkhan gyi mgor phog nas de dus la bab pa dang / dge slong de dag tshe dang ldan pa dag bsod snyoms pa las med pa las byung bas /
analyzed: dge slong gi lag nas phyam shor bas shing mkhan gyi mgor phog nas de dus la bab pa dang / dge slong de dag tshe dang ldan pa dag bsod snyoms pa las med pa las byung bas /
translated: A monk dropped a mortar on the head of a carpenter, who died.🔽The monks became anxious, thinking, “We have incurred a defeating offense.”

original: bdag cag la pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba ma byung ngam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bdag cag la pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba ma byung ngam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks reported this to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag khyed la ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed la ni ltung ba med de /
translated: “Monks, you have not incurred a defeating offense.

original: yang dge slong dag gis mi bzod pa'i khur gdeg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong dag gis mi bzod pa'i khur gdeg par mi bya'o //
translated: Monks, you should not carry an unbearable load.🔽If such a condition arises, you should make a layperson carry it.

original: rkyen de lta bu zhig byung na mdor khyim pa dag 'dzin du gzhug par bya zhing gdeg pa dang / gzhag pa dag kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu zhig byung na mdor khyim pa dag 'dzin du gzhug par bya zhing gdeg pa dang / gzhag pa dag kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: You should say, ‘Pick it up’ and ‘Put it down.’

original: mnyam du gdeg pa dang mnyam du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam du gdeg pa dang mnyam du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: You should pick it up together and put it down together.”

original: dge slong dag mi bzod pa'i khur 'degs par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag mi bzod pa'i khur 'degs par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: “Monks, if you carry an unbearable load, you will be in conflict with the Dharma.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gis mi bzod pa'i khur gdeg par mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas /🔽dge slong rnams kyis ji tsam ni bzod pa yin /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gis mi bzod pa'i khur gdeg par mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal nas / dge slong rnams kyis ji tsam ni bzod pa yin /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, you should not carry an unbearable load.”

original: ji tsam ni mi bzod pa yin pa mi shes nas /
analyzed: ji tsam ni mi bzod pa yin pa mi shes nas /
translated: The monks did not know how much was bearable and how much was not.🔽“Blessed One, how much is bearable and how much is not?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: khyim pa gcig gi khur gang yin pa de dag dge slong gnyis kyis gdeg par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa gcig gi khur gang yin pa de dag dge slong gnyis kyis gdeg par bya'o //
translated: “The load of one layperson should be carried by two monks.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyam yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyam yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Jetavana, Anāthapiṇḍada’s Park near Śrāvastī.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas gtum mo btul te skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bkod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas gtum mo btul te skyabs su 'gro ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la bkod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When Venerable Udayī subdued Caṇḍa and established him in the refuges and precepts,

original: des tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i rkang pa gnyis la @208a *//
analyzed: des tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka'i rkang pa gnyis la @208a *//
translated: Caṇḍa bowed down at the feet of Venerable Udayī

original: phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: and said,🔽“Venerable, please accept my invitation to take your meal tomorrow at my house.”

original: yo byad thams cad kyis bstabs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas dang du ma blangs te smras pa /
analyzed: yo byad thams cad kyis bstabs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas dang du ma blangs te smras pa /
translated: He offered all his possessions, but the venerable Udayin did not accept them and said,

original: sring mo bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa ni gzhan la phan pas rjes su 'dzin par zhugs pa yin pas /
analyzed: sring mo bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa ni gzhan la phan pas rjes su 'dzin par zhugs pa yin pas /
translated: “Sister, the teaching of the Blessed One is dedicated to helping others.

original: kho bos kyang gzhan la phan par byed dgos so //
analyzed: kho bos kyang gzhan la phan par byed dgos so //
translated: I must also help others.”

original: gtum mos smras pa /
analyzed: gtum mos smras pa /
translated: Caṇḍakāḷī said,

original: 'phags pa gal te de lta lags te dang du mi bzhes na /
analyzed: 'phags pa gal te de lta lags te dang du mi bzhes na /
translated: “Noble one, if that is so and you will not accept them,

original: bdag gis 'phags pa'i slad du drang srong gi gdan bsham par bgyis /
analyzed: bdag gis 'phags pa'i slad du drang srong gi gdan bsham par bgyis /
translated: I will prepare a sage’s seat for you.

original: khyod kyis bsod snyoms brgyus nas /
analyzed: khyod kyis bsod snyoms brgyus nas /
translated: You should take your alms round,

original: drang srong gi gdan la longs spyad de gshegs par rigs so //
analyzed: drang srong gi gdan la longs spyad de gshegs par rigs so //
translated: enjoy the sage’s seat, and then leave.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas smras pa /
translated: The venerable Udayin said,🔽“Sister, I will do just that.”

original: sring mo de bzhin bya'o zhes tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka nyi ma re re zhing bsod snyoms brgyus nas /
analyzed: sring mo de bzhin bya'o zhes tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka nyi ma re re zhing bsod snyoms brgyus nas /
translated: Every day the venerable Udayin took his alms round,

original: gtum mo'i khyim du drang srong gi /
analyzed: gtum mo'i khyim du drang srong gi /
translated: enjoyed the sage’s seat in Caṇḍakāḷī’s house,

original: stan la longs spyad de 'gro'o //
analyzed: stan la longs spyad de 'gro'o //
translated: and then left.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la ljongs su bya ba zhig byung nas /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la ljongs su bya ba zhig byung nas /
translated: After some time, the venerable Udayin had some business in the countryside.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas bsams pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas bsams pa /
translated: The venerable Udayin thought,

original: bdag je song la sring mo blta bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag je song la sring mo blta bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “I will go and see my sister.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka gtum mo'i gan du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka gtum mo'i gan du song ste smras pa /
translated: The venerable Udayin went to Caṇḍakāḷī and said,

original: sring mo kho bo ljongs rgyur 'gro'i //
analyzed: sring mo kho bo ljongs rgyur 'gro'i //
translated: “Sister, I am going to travel in the countryside.

original: khyod kyis chos kyi lus la bag gyis shig /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos kyi lus la bag gyis shig /
translated: You should take care of the body of the Dharma.”

original: gtum mos smras pa /🔽'phags pa myur du slar gshegs pa'i rigs te; der bzhugs par mi mdzad cing /
analyzed: gtum mos smras pa / 'phags pa myur du slar gshegs pa'i rigs te; der bzhugs par mi mdzad cing /
translated: Caṇḍakāḷī said,🔽“Noble one, it is fitting that you return quickly.

original: der dgyes pa mi bskyed du gsol /
analyzed: der dgyes pa mi bskyed du gsol /
translated: Do not stay there and do not take pleasure in it.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas gtum mo bltas te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas gtum mo bltas te /
translated: The venerable Udayin looked at Caṇḍakāḷī🔽and went to travel in the countryside.

original: ljongs rgyur 'phags pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos @208b dge slong rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: ljongs rgyur 'phags pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos @208b dge slong rnams la smras pa /
translated: The venerable Ānanda said to the monks,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das ljongs rgyur gshegs kyis /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das ljongs rgyur gshegs kyis /
translated: “Venerable sirs, the Blessed One is traveling in the countryside.

original: khyed cag las gang bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig ljongs rgyur 'gro bar spro ba des chos gos kyi las gyis shig /
analyzed: khyed cag las gang bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig ljongs rgyur 'gro bar spro ba des chos gos kyi las gyis shig /
translated: “Whoever among you is eager to travel through the countryside with the Blessed One should make a robe.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas thos nas bsams pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas thos nas bsams pa /
translated: The venerable Udayin heard this and thought,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rgyu ba la ni phan yon bco brgyad yod de /🔽rgyal po'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa med pa dang / me'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / mi'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / klu'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / gdug pa'i 'jigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rgyu ba la ni phan yon bco brgyad yod de / rgyal po'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / chom rkun gyi 'jigs pa med pa dang / me'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / mi'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / klu'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / gdug pa'i 'jigs pa med pa dang /
translated: “There are eighteen benefits to following the Buddha:🔽There is no fear of kings, no fear of thieves, no fear of fire, no fear of humans, no fear of non-humans, no fear of nāgas, no fear of vipers,

original: seng ge'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / stag gi 'jigs pa med pa dang / gung gi 'jigs pa med pa dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyi 'jigs pa med pa dang / spyang ki'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / sho gam gyi 'jigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: seng ge'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / stag gi 'jigs pa med pa dang / gung gi 'jigs pa med pa dang / pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyi 'jigs pa med pa dang / spyang ki'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / sho gam gyi 'jigs pa med pa dang /
translated: no fear of lions, no fear of tigers, no fear of leopards, no fear of enemy armies, no fear of wolves, no fear of tolls,

original: la gcan gyi 'jigs pa med pa dang / gru btsas kyi 'jigs pa med pa dang / dus dang dus su lha'i gzugs dag mthong zhing lha'i sgra dag thos la kun shes pa brda sprod pa dag thos pa dang / chos kyi longs spyod dang /
analyzed: la gcan gyi 'jigs pa med pa dang / gru btsas kyi 'jigs pa med pa dang / dus dang dus su lha'i gzugs dag mthong zhing lha'i sgra dag thos la kun shes pa brda sprod pa dag thos pa dang / chos kyi longs spyod dang /
translated: There is no fear of wild beasts, no fear of boat fares, and from time to time one sees the forms of gods, hears the sounds of gods, and hears the sounds of the omniscient ones.🔽There is the enjoyment of the Dharma,

original: zang zing gi longs spyod yod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyu ba la gnod pa nyung ba yin gyis /
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod yod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyu ba la gnod pa nyung ba yin gyis /
translated: the enjoyment of material things, and there is little harm to the Buddha’s lineage.

original: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig ljongs rgyur 'gro'i /
analyzed: bdag kyang bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig ljongs rgyur 'gro'i /
translated: I too will go to the countryside with the Bhagavān.

original: phyir ldog par bya'o snyam nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka phyir log go /
analyzed: phyir ldog par bya'o snyam nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka phyir log go /
translated: I will return.” The venerable Udayī turned back.

original: de'i bar skabs su gtum mo'i khyim du bu mo zhig la khye'u zhig btsas nas /
analyzed: de'i bar skabs su gtum mo'i khyim du bu mo zhig la khye'u zhig btsas nas /
translated: In the meantime, in Caṇḍa’s house a girl gave birth to a boy.

original: gtum mos khye'u de'i ma la smras pa /
analyzed: gtum mos khye'u de'i ma la smras pa /
translated: Caṇḍa said to the boy’s mother,

original: bu mo khye'u 'di khrus gyis la gos dkar pos dkris te /
analyzed: bu mo khye'u 'di khrus gyis la gos dkar pos dkris te /
translated: “Girl, bathe this boy, wrap him in white cloth,

original: @209a *// drang srong gi stan 'di la snyol cig dang / yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: @209a *// drang srong gi stan 'di la snyol cig dang / yun ring du 'tsho bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and place him on this sage’s seat, and he will live a long time.

original: tshe ring du skyong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe ring du skyong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “He will live a long time.”

original: bu mo des khye'u de khrus byas te gos dkar pos dkris nas /
analyzed: bu mo des khye'u de khrus byas te gos dkar pos dkris nas /
translated: The girl bathed the boy, wrapped him in white cloth,

original: drang srong de'i stan de la rtag tu bsnyal lo //
analyzed: drang srong de'i stan de la rtag tu bsnyal lo //
translated: and laid him on the sage’s seat.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka yang nyi ma gzhan zhig na bsod snyoms la zhugs nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka yang nyi ma gzhan zhig na bsod snyoms la zhugs nas /
translated: One day Venerable Udayin went out for alms.

original: gtum mo'i khyim ga la ba der song ngo //
analyzed: gtum mo'i khyim ga la ba der song ngo //
translated: He went to Caṇḍā’s house.

original: dgra bcom pa dag ni ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag ni ma bsams par shes pa dang mthong ba mi 'jug pas /
translated: Arhats do not see or know anything without first reflecting on it.

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka de bzhin du drang srong gi stan de la 'dug pa dang / bud med kyi yul de brtad pa dang bcas shing /🔽'phags pa khye'u /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka de bzhin du drang srong gi stan de la 'dug pa dang / bud med kyi yul de brtad pa dang bcas shing / 'phags pa khye'u /
translated: So Venerable Udayin sat down on the sage’s seat, and the woman,🔽“Noble boy,

original: 'phags pa khye'u zhes zer nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa khye'u zhes zer nas /
translated: Noble boy,”

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka myur du langs te bltas na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka myur du langs te bltas na /
translated: and Venerable Udayin quickly got up and looked.

original: khye'u dus la bab pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: khye'u dus la bab pa mthong ngo //
translated: He saw that the boy had died.

original: khyim mi dag gis cho nges gdab par brtsams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas smras pa /
analyzed: khyim mi dag gis cho nges gdab par brtsams pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas smras pa /
translated: The family began to wail, but Venerable Udayin said,🔽“Do not wail.

original: sring mo ma ngu zhig /
analyzed: sring mo ma ngu zhig /
translated: “Sister, don’t cry.

original: sems can 'dis tshe thung bar 'gyur ba'i las byas te /
analyzed: sems can 'dis tshe thung bar 'gyur ba'i las byas te /
translated: This being has done an action that will result in a short life.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'du byed thams cad ni mi rtag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One has said, ‘All conditioned things are impermanent.’

original: de lta mod kyi 'di la kho bos ngud mos gdab par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'di la kho bos ngud mos gdab par bya ba yin te /
translated: Still, I will cry for her.

original: 'di ltar kho bos dgra bcom pa nyid thob kyang kho bo la brten te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bos dgra bcom pa nyid thob kyang kho bo la brten te bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dul ba la nyan thos rnams kyi bslab pa'i gzhi 'cha' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Though I have attained arhatship, I will rely on her so that the Blessed One will establish a training rule for the monks in the monastic code.’

original: des skabs de dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
analyzed: des skabs de dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
translated: He told the monks what had happened,🔽and the monks reported it to the Blessed One.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag dge slong 'char ka la @209b ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong 'char ka la @209b ni ltung ba med de /
translated: “The monk Udayī has not committed a transgression.

original: yang dge slong gis khyim gzhan du stan la ma brtags par 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gis khyim gzhan du stan la ma brtags par 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: Still, monks should not sit on a seat in a house without first checking the seat.

original: 'dug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do, they commit an offense.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: mnyan yod na khyim bdag phyug pa /
analyzed: mnyan yod na khyim bdag phyug pa /
translated: In Śrāvastī there were two householders,

original: nor mang ba /
analyzed: nor mang ba /
translated: one wealthy

original: longs spyod che ba /🔽phan tshun gtam 'dres pa /🔽phebs par smra ba /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba / phan tshun gtam 'dres pa / phebs par smra ba /
translated: and the other of great means,🔽who were friends,🔽who spoke pleasantly to each other,

original: 'grogs bshes / smos 'drin gnyis shig 'khod do //
analyzed: 'grogs bshes / smos 'drin gnyis shig 'khod do //
translated: who were companions, and who were intimate.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan na de gnyis nor zad pa dang / longs spyod zad par gyur nas /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan na de gnyis nor zad pa dang / longs spyod zad par gyur nas /
translated: Later, when their wealth and means were exhausted,

original: de gnyis kyis gros bya bar brtsams pa /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis gros bya bar brtsams pa /
translated: they began to discuss what to do.

original: bdag cag gnyis 'di nyid du ma thos pa dang dmas par gyur pas rnam pa 'di lta bu'i 'tsho ba za zhing longs spyod pas ci bya /
analyzed: bdag cag gnyis 'di nyid du ma thos pa dang dmas par gyur pas rnam pa 'di lta bu'i 'tsho ba za zhing longs spyod pas ci bya /
translated: “We have come to this place without having heard anything. We are destitute. What will we eat and enjoy for a living like this?”

original: rab tu 'byung du 'dong ngo zhes de gnyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ngo //🔽de na gcig na bar gyur nas /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung du 'dong ngo zhes de gnyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ngo // de na gcig na bar gyur nas /
translated: “Let’s go forth.” The two of them went forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.🔽One of them became sick.

original: cig shos de'i nad g-yog byed do //
analyzed: cig shos de'i nad g-yog byed do //
translated: The other nursed him.

original: nad pa de nyams dmas shing sos par ma gyur nas /
analyzed: nad pa de nyams dmas shing sos par ma gyur nas /
translated: The patient was weak and did not recover.

original: nad g-yog des nad pa la smras pa /
analyzed: nad g-yog des nad pa la smras pa /
translated: The attendant asked the patient,

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod la sngon khyim ba'i tshe na lan 'ga' nad 'di lta bu byung ngam /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod la sngon khyim ba'i tshe na lan 'ga' nad 'di lta bu byung ngam /
translated: “Venerable, did you ever have this illness before you were a layman?”

original: sngon yang byung ngo //
analyzed: sngon yang byung ngo //
translated: “Yes, I did.”

original: 'o na ci zhig gis zhi bar gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig gis zhi bar gyur /
translated: “What cured you?”

original: lan tshva'i sman rtsabs kyis so //
analyzed: lan tshva'i sman rtsabs kyis so //
translated: “A root medicine with salt.”

original: 'o na de ci'i phyir lan tshva'i sman rtsabs mi 'thung zhes nad g-yog des lan tshva'i sman rtsabs bslangs te nad pa la blud pa dang / nad pa de dus kyi chos dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: 'o na de ci'i phyir lan tshva'i sman rtsabs mi 'thung zhes nad g-yog des lan tshva'i sman rtsabs bslangs te nad pa la blud pa dang / nad pa de dus kyi chos dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: “Why don’t you drink a root medicine with salt?” The attendant asked for a root medicine with salt and gave it to the patient to drink.🔽The patient died.

original: dge slong de bdag gis 'di la sman pa yin pa byin par ma gyur tam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes nas /🔽des skabs de @210a *//
analyzed: dge slong de bdag gis 'di la sman pa yin pa byin par ma gyur tam snyam du 'gyod pa skyes nas / des skabs de @210a *//
translated: The monk thought, “Did I give him the wrong medicine?”

original: dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la brjod nas /
translated: He told the monks what had happened.

original: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks asked the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, that monk did not give the wrong medicine.

original: dge slong dag dge slong de la ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong de la ni ltung ba med de /
translated: “Monks, that monk has no offense.

original: yang dge slong gis sman pa la ma dris par rang gi blos nad pa la sman sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gis sman pa la ma dris par rang gi blos nad pa la sman sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, a monk should not, without asking a physician, give medicine to the sick according to his own ideas.

original: gal te sman pa med na sman pa rab tu byung ba la dri bar bya'o //🔽sman pa rab tu byung ba med na sman pas bkol ba la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sman pa med na sman pa rab tu byung ba la dri bar bya'o // sman pa rab tu byung ba med na sman pas bkol ba la dri bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no physician, he should ask a monk who is a physician.🔽If there is no monk who is a physician, he should ask someone who has been trained by a physician.

original: sman pas bkol ba med na nad kyis thebs pa la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman pas bkol ba med na nad kyis thebs pa la dri bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no one who has been trained by a physician, he should ask someone who has experience with illness.

original: nad kyis thebs pa med na dge slong rgan pa rgan pa dag la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: nad kyis thebs pa med na dge slong rgan pa rgan pa dag la dri bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no one who has experience with illness, he should ask the senior monks.

original: dge slong gis sman pa la ma dris sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis sman pa la ma dris sam /
translated: If a monk does not ask a physician,

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rim ba bzhin ma byas par rang gi blos nad pa la sman sbyin na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rim ba bzhin ma byas par rang gi blos nad pa la sman sbyin na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: or does not act according to the instructions, and gives medicine to the sick according to his own ideas, he becomes guilty of an offense.

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas /
translated: The monks were doubtful,

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: and asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the Blessed One who clears away all doubts,

original: btsun pa dge slong de la sman gang lags pa de nyid sman ma lags pa nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu ni gang lags /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong de la sman gang lags pa de nyid sman ma lags pa nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu ni gang lags /
translated: “Venerable, what is the cause and what is the condition for the medicine that is for that monk to become not medicine?”

original: rkyen ni gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen ni gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the cause and what is the condition for the medicine that is for that monk to become not medicine?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de sngon khyim pa'i tshe na rlung dang bad kan can du gyur la /
analyzed: de sngon khyim pa'i tshe na rlung dang bad kan can du gyur la /
translated: “In his previous life as a householder, he had wind and phlegm disorders.

original: da ltar ni rlung dang mkhris pa can du gyur pas /
analyzed: da ltar ni rlung dang mkhris pa can du gyur pas /
translated: Now he has wind and bile disorders.

original: des na de la sman gang yin pa de nyid sman ma yin pa nyid du gyur to //
analyzed: des na de la sman gang yin pa de nyid sman ma yin pa nyid du gyur to //
translated: Therefore, the medicine that is for him becomes not medicine.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at Śrāvastī, in Jeta’s Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada’s park.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ma ga dhar byung @210b ba'i rgyal po bzo sbyangs gzugs can snying po lha brgyad khri dang / ma ga dhar byung ba'i bram ze dang khyim bdag brgya stong phrag du ma dang lhan cig bden pa dag la bkod pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ma ga dhar byung @210b ba'i rgyal po bzo sbyangs gzugs can snying po lha brgyad khri dang / ma ga dhar byung ba'i bram ze dang khyim bdag brgya stong phrag du ma dang lhan cig bden pa dag la bkod pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the Blessed One established King Bimbisāra of Magadha, eighty thousand gods, and many hundreds of thousands of brahmins and householders of Magadha in the truths,
