analyzed: ma ga dhar byung ba'i rgyal po bzo sbyangs gzugs can snying pos /
translated: King Bimbisāra of Magadhad🔽had this proclamation made in Rājagṛha:

original: rgyal po'i khab tu 'di skad ces rgyal po'i khab tu 'khod pa dang / pho brang 'khor ba dang / yul tha dad pa nas lhags pa'i tshong ba'i tshogs shes ldan dag nyon cig /
analyzed: rgyal po'i khab tu 'di skad ces rgyal po'i khab tu 'khod pa dang / pho brang 'khor ba dang / yul tha dad pa nas lhags pa'i tshong ba'i tshogs shes ldan dag nyon cig /
translated: “Listen, sirs, you who are assembled in Rājagṛha, the court, and the various countries, you merchants!

original: nga'i yul du gang gis kyang chom rkun mi bya'o //
analyzed: nga'i yul du gang gis kyang chom rkun mi bya'o //
translated: In my country, no one should commit theft.

original: gang nga'i yul du chom rkun byed pa de ngas yul med par bya'o //
analyzed: gang nga'i yul du chom rkun byed pa de ngas yul med par bya'o //
translated: Whoever commits theft in my country, I will banish from the country.

original: bcom pa rnams kyi rkun rdzas ni nga'i mdzod dang bang ba nas sbyin no zhes dril gyi sgra bsgrags pa byas so //
analyzed: bcom pa rnams kyi rkun rdzas ni nga'i mdzod dang bang ba nas sbyin no zhes dril gyi sgra bsgrags pa byas so //
translated: The stolen goods of those who are robbed will be given from my treasury and granary.”

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gzhon nu'i dpe'i mdo sdes btul ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gzhon nu'i dpe'i mdo sdes btul ba de'i tshe na /
translated: When the Blessed One had tamed King Prasenajit of Kosala with the sūtra of the parable of the young man,

original: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis kyang mnyan yod du 'di skad ces mnyan yod na 'khod pa dang / pho brang 'khor ba dang / yul tha dad pa nas lhags pa'i tshong pa'i tshogs shes ldan dag nyon cig /
analyzed: ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis kyang mnyan yod du 'di skad ces mnyan yod na 'khod pa dang / pho brang 'khor ba dang / yul tha dad pa nas lhags pa'i tshong pa'i tshogs shes ldan dag nyon cig /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala proclaimed in Śrāvastī: “Listen, assembly of merchants residing in Śrāvastī, in the palace, and from various lands!

original: nga'i yul du gang gis kyang chom rkun mi bya'o //
analyzed: nga'i yul du gang gis kyang chom rkun mi bya'o //
translated: In my country, no one should commit robbery.

original: gang nga'i yul du chom rkun byed pa des ngas gsad pa'i gyod la bskrin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang nga'i yul du chom rkun byed pa des ngas gsad pa'i gyod la bskrin par bya'o //
translated: Whoever commits robbery in my country will be punished by death.

original: bcom pa rnams kyi rkun rdzas ni nga'i mdzod dang bang ba nas sbyin no zhes dril gyi sgra bsgrags pa byas so //
analyzed: bcom pa rnams kyi rkun rdzas ni nga'i mdzod dang bang ba nas sbyin no zhes dril gyi sgra bsgrags pa byas so //
translated: The stolen goods of those who have been robbed will be given to them from my treasury and granary.”🔽He had this proclamation made.

original: de'i bar skabs na chom rkun pa gang dag yul ma ga dha na gnas pa dag dang chom rkun pa gang dag yul go sa la na gnas pa de dag sa mtshams kyi bar du dong ste 'khod do /
analyzed: de'i bar skabs na chom rkun pa gang dag yul ma ga dha na gnas pa dag dang chom rkun pa gang dag yul go sa la na gnas pa de dag sa mtshams kyi bar du dong ste 'khod do /
translated: In the meantime, the bandits who lived in Magadha and the bandits who lived in Kosala went to the border and stayed there.

original: @211a *// thams cad du chom rkun pa gang dag yul ma ga dha na gnas pa dag dang / chom rkun pa gang dag yul ko sa la na gnas pa de dag sa mtshams kyi bar du dong ste /
analyzed: @211a *// thams cad du chom rkun pa gang dag yul ma ga dha na gnas pa dag dang / chom rkun pa gang dag yul ko sa la na gnas pa de dag sa mtshams kyi bar du dong ste /
translated: Everywhere, the bandits who lived in Magadha and the bandits who lived in Kosala went to the border and stayed there.

original: 'khod cing don mthun 'joms par byed do zhes bya ba'i sgra de lta bus kyang khyab par gyur to //
analyzed: 'khod cing don mthun 'joms par byed do zhes bya ba'i sgra de lta bus kyang khyab par gyur to //
translated: The sound of “They are destroying the caravans!” spread in this way.

original: de thos nas yul ma ga dha nas don mthun bsel ba dang bcas pas /🔽yul ko sa lar 'gro bar brtsams shing /
analyzed: de thos nas yul ma ga dha nas don mthun bsel ba dang bcas pas / yul ko sa lar 'gro bar brtsams shing /
translated: Having heard that, the caravans from Magadha, with their guides,🔽set out for Kosala,

original: yul ko sa la nas kyang don mthun bsel ba dang bcas pas yul ma ga dhar 'gro bar brtsams so //
analyzed: yul ko sa la nas kyang don mthun bsel ba dang bcas pas yul ma ga dhar 'gro bar brtsams so //
translated: and from Kosala, the caravans, with their guides, set out for Magadha.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na yul ma ga dha nas don mthun bsel ba dang bcas pa yul ko sa lar 'phags nas de gang gi tshe sa mtshams kyi bar las 'das te yul ko sa lar zhugs pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na yul ma ga dha nas don mthun bsel ba dang bcas pa yul ko sa lar 'phags nas de gang gi tshe sa mtshams kyi bar las 'das te yul ko sa lar zhugs pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When they had passed the border and entered Kosala,

original: ded dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: ded dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: the caravan leader said,

original: shes ldan dag ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'di ni gtum pa /
analyzed: shes ldan dag ko sa lar byung ba'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'di ni gtum pa /
translated: “Sirs, King Prasenajit of Kosala is known to be fierce,

original: brtun das pa /🔽drag shul che ba /
analyzed: brtun das pa / drag shul che ba /
translated: impulsive,🔽violent,

original: dpa' ba / rtsal che ba zhes grags pas /
analyzed: dpa' ba / rtsal che ba zhes grags pas /
translated: brave, and strong.

original: gal te don mthun chom rkun pas bcom par gyur na yang /
analyzed: gal te don mthun chom rkun pas bcom par gyur na yang /
translated: If the caravan is attacked by robbers,

original: des bdag cag la rkun rdzas sbyin par nus kyis bsel ba phyir thong zhig /
analyzed: des bdag cag la rkun rdzas sbyin par nus kyis bsel ba phyir thong zhig /
translated: he can give us the stolen goods. Let’s rest.”

original: don mthun dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: don mthun dag gis smras pa /
translated: The caravan members said,

original: ded dpon gal te de lta na de ltar bgyi'o zhes de dag gis bsel ba phyir btang ngo //
analyzed: ded dpon gal te de lta na de ltar bgyi'o zhes de dag gis bsel ba phyir btang ngo //
translated: “Caravan leader, if that’s the case, let’s do that.” They rested.

original: chom rkun pa dag gis bya ma rta bzhag ste 'khod pa dang / bya ma rta dag gis bsel ba phyir btang ba de mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: chom rkun pa dag gis bya ma rta bzhag ste 'khod pa dang / bya ma rta dag gis bsel ba phyir btang ba de mthong nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The birds saw that the caravan had been attacked and driven away. They said,

analyzed: bcu bdun sde dag gal te gcig la las su bsko ba bab na yang de dag thams cad bsdongs te byed do //

analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na gtsug lag khang der mtshan thogs thag tu chos mnyan pa byung nas der de dag thams cad kyis bsdongs te tron byas so //

analyzed: phyi de nyin par dge 'dun gyi bsro gang byung nas der yang de dag thams cad kyis bsdongs te tron byas so //
translated: The next day, a bath for the saṅgha was held, and there they all gathered together and served.

original: de'i phyi de nyin par bcu bdun sde las gcig la dge skos bab nas de'i nyin mo yang thams cad kyis gtsug lag khang brgyan te 'khod do //
analyzed: de'i phyi de nyin par bcu bdun sde las gcig la dge skos bab nas de'i nyin mo yang thams cad kyis gtsug lag khang brgyan te 'khod do //
translated: The next day, one of the group of seventeen was assigned as the monk in charge of the monastery, and on that day, too, they all gathered together and decorated the monastery.

original: de na dge skos tron byed pa'i tshe bcu bdun sde las gcig la blo byung ba bdag ni chad kyis nyal lo //
analyzed: de na dge skos tron byed pa'i tshe bcu bdun sde las gcig la blo byung ba bdag ni chad kyis nyal lo //

original: mi bcu drug gis ci'i phyir tron mi nus snyam mo //
analyzed: mi bcu drug gis ci'i phyir tron mi nus snyam mo //
translated: The other sixteen thought, “Why should we do the counting?”

original: de bzhin du re re la yang blo de lta bu byung nas gzhan bcu drug po thams cad so sor nyal du dong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du re re la yang blo de lta bu byung nas gzhan bcu drug po thams cad so sor nyal du dong ngo //
translated: Each of them had the same thought, and all sixteen of them went off to sleep.

original: dge skos de 'ba' zhig gcig pus mtshan thog thag las byas te /
analyzed: dge skos de 'ba' zhig gcig pus mtshan thog thag las byas te /
translated: The monk in charge of the monastery was left all alone. He did the counting all night.

original: mtshan mo nam nangs pa dang / mar me'i kong bu dag bsdus /
analyzed: mtshan mo nam nangs pa dang / mar me'i kong bu dag bsdus /

analyzed: sgo dag phye /

original: gtsug lag khang chag chag btab /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang chag chag btab /
translated: swept the temple,

original: byug pa byas te /
analyzed: byug pa byas te /
translated: and anointed it.

original: dus shes par byas nas stan bshams shing mchod rten gyi 'khor sar bdug spos brims te /
analyzed: dus shes par byas nas stan bshams shing mchod rten gyi 'khor sar bdug spos brims te /
translated: He set out the seats, made sure it was the right time, and lit incense in the courtyard of the stūpa.

analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi steng du 'greng nas gand'i brdung bar brtsams so //

analyzed: de nas bcu drug po de dag gand'i'i sgras sad nas /

analyzed: rang rang gi gnas khang dag nas lhung bzed thogs te byung ba dang / de dag gis @214b dge skos de gcig pu phar rgyugs tshur rgyug cing 'dug pa mthong nas /

original: de dag gis phan tshun smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis phan tshun smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di gcig pu phar rgyug tshur rgyug cing 'dug na /
translated: “Venerables, he is running back and forth by himself.

original: yu bu cag las sus kyang 'di'i grogs ma byas sam /
analyzed: yu bu cag las sus kyang 'di'i grogs ma byas sam /
translated: Has anyone helped him?”

analyzed: gcig gis smras pa /

analyzed: kho bo la blo byung ba bdag ni chad kyi nyal lo //
translated: “I thought, ‘I’m tired. I’ll sleep.’

analyzed: mi bcu drug gis ci'i phyir tron mi nus snyam mo //
translated: I thought, ‘Why can’t sixteen people help him?’”

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang de skad zer / gzhan dag kyang zer te /

original: de nas bcu drug po dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bcu drug po dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'di bdag cag gi 'phral gyi bya ba thams cad la thog mar 'gro ba yin na /
translated: “Venerables, he is the first to do all our practical work.

analyzed: bdag cag gis 'di'i grogs ma byas pa ni yu bu cag gis ma legs pa byas te /
translated: “We have not helped him. We have done wrong.

analyzed: 'di bdag cag la gshe bar 'gyur gyis /

analyzed: zan zos ma thag tu bzod pa gsol bar bya'o zhes de dag gis zan zos nas bzod pa gsol bar brtsams te /

analyzed: gzhon pa rnams kyis ni de'i rkang pa gnyis la gtugs /

translated: He remained silent.🔽One of his close friends broke wind.

analyzed: de dang ches bshes pa gcig yod pa des ga ga tshil byas pa dang / des dgod par brtsams te bzod do zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: He began to laugh and said, “I forgive you.”

original: de dag gis bsams pa /
analyzed: de dag gis bsams pa /
translated: They thought,

analyzed: de ni thabs legs pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: “That is a good idea.”

analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ga ga tshil byas shing de bzhin du thams cad kyi bar gyis ga ga tshil byas pa dang / de rlung gyen du 'chugs te dus la bab bo // de dag brtad @215a *//
translated: The wind rose up and the time came.🔽They began to lament and wail.

analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

analyzed: bdag cag sngon ni bcu bdun sder gyur na /
translated: “Previously we were the Group of Seventeen,

analyzed: da ni bcu drug sder gyur te /
translated: but now we are the Group of Sixteen.

analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa yid du 'ong pa dang bral zhing pham par gyur pa'i ltung ba byung ngo //
translated: We have been separated from our attractive companions in the celibate life and have incurred a downfall that is a pārājika offense.”

original: dge slong de dag gis ma legs so zhes smras te dong ngo //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis ma legs so zhes smras te dong ngo //
translated: Those monks said, “That’s not good,” and left.

original: bcu drug po de dag kyang mtha' cig tu dong ste /
analyzed: bcu drug po de dag kyang mtha' cig tu dong ste /

analyzed: sems khong du chud cing 'khod pa /

original: dge slong gzhan dag gis mthong nas /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag gis mthong nas /
translated: and asked,🔽“Why are you sitting here with your minds troubled?”

original: dge slong de dag gis sbyor bar brtsams te /
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis sbyor bar brtsams te /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa bcu bdun sde 'di dag ni sog ma'i me bzhin du skad cig gis 'bar zhing skad cig gis shi bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Venerable Upasena, these seventeen monks are like a fire of straw. They flare up in an instant and die in an instant.

analyzed: yud tsam zhig gis rgod bag byed cing yud tsam zhig gis sems khong du chud cing 'khod do zhes zer ro; ;de dag mya ngan gyi mes yid gdungs pas /
translated: They are boisterous for a moment and then sit with their minds withdrawn.”

analyzed: yongs su spyod kyang cang mi smra bar 'khod pa'i skabs de dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong de rnams la ni ltung ba med de /

analyzed: yang dge slong gis ga ga tshil mi bya'o //

original: byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro ////
analyzed: byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro ////
translated: If you do, you become guilty of an offense.”

original: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa /
analyzed: 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa /
translated: The Vinaya in Elaboration,

original: bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: Eleventh Section

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //

analyzed: mnyan yod nas ha cang mi ring ba @215b na ri brags shig yod pa de na khyim bdag phyug pa nor mang ba longs spyod che ba zhig 'dug ste /

original: de yang dad pa can bzang ba dge ba'i bsams pa can yin pas /
analyzed: de yang dad pa can bzang ba dge ba'i bsams pa can yin pas /

original: des dge 'dun la bsdos te /
analyzed: des dge 'dun la bsdos te /

analyzed: gtsug lag khang rta babs mthon po dang / skar khung dang / skar khung dra ba can dang / lan kan gyis brgyan pa /

analyzed: snying dang mig 'phrog pa /
translated: captivating the heart and the eye,

analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na dge slong gzhan drug cu ljongs rgyu zhing 'gro ba na ri brags der phyin nas /

analyzed: bsti gnas rnyan par byed pa na mi zhig gis smras pa /
translated: When they were looking for a place to stay, someone said,

analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag ci'i slad du gtsug lag khang du mi gnas /

analyzed: bzhin bzang gtsug lag khang ga la yod /

original: 'phags pa dag dgon pa 'di na'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag dgon pa 'di na'o //

analyzed: sbyangs tsags g-yar nas smras pa /

translated: That man went to the householder and said,

analyzed: smras pa / khyim bdag dgyes pa skyed cig /
translated: “Householder, rejoice!

original: khyod kyi gtsug lag @216a *//
analyzed: khyod kyi gtsug lag @216a *//

original: khang du dge slong glo bur du lhags pa drug cu mchis so //
analyzed: khang du dge slong glo bur du lhags pa drug cu mchis so //
translated: there are sixty newly arrived monks.”

analyzed: khyim bdag gus par bsgrim pa dang bcas pas nang mi dag la smras pa /
translated: The householder, with great respect, said to his family,

analyzed: shes ldan dag kho bo'i gtsug lag khang du dge slong gi dge 'dun byon pa de dag legs par sbyar ba'i btung bas tshim par byas /
translated: “Sirs, the saṅgha of monks has come to my temple. I have satisfied them with well-prepared drinks.

analyzed: bu ram dang hvags dang li khar dang dgun dang bal bu se'u long zhig ces khyim bdag legs par sbyar ba'i btung ba sbyar nas gtsug lag khang du song ba dang / dge slong dag kyang chu btsags te rang rang gi spyod lam gyis 'khod do //
translated: The monks had strained the water and were sitting in their own postures.

analyzed: khyim bdag des dge slong de dag thag ring po kho na nas mthong ste /

analyzed: des gtsug lag khang de mtsho padmas gang ba bzhin du mthong nas /
translated: He saw that the monastery was like a lake filled with lotuses.

analyzed: rgya cher dad pa'i shugs kyis bsgyur ba'i rgyud kyis tshigs su bcad pa smras pa /
translated: He spoke this verse, his mind transformed by the power of his vast faith:

analyzed: grong ngam yang na dgon pa'ang rung //

original: gshong ngam yang na thang yang rung //
analyzed: gshong ngam yang na thang yang rung //
translated: whether it is a valley or a plain,

original: gang na 'os pa gnas pa yi //
analyzed: gang na 'os pa gnas pa yi //
translated: wherever there is a suitable place,

original: sa gzhi de ni dga' byed yin //
analyzed: sa gzhi de ni dga' byed yin //
translated: that ground is delightful.

analyzed: de nas legs par sbyar ba'i btung ba sta gon byas te /

analyzed: rang gi lag nas dge slong gi dge 'dun de tshim par byas nas /

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis yon bshad nas //

analyzed: khyim bdag des rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te /

translated: He said, “Please accept an invitation to the community of noble monks to take their meal at my house tomorrow.” The monks accepted,

analyzed: khyim bdag des rkang pa gnyis la phyag 'tshal te song ngo //
translated: and the householder prostrated at their feet and left.

analyzed: khyim bdag des phyi de nyin par zas bsod pas dge slong dag tshim par byas shing dus ma yin par yang btung ba blud nas /
translated: The next day the householder satisfied the monks with delicious food and gave them drinks out of season.

original: dge slong rnams kyis kyang chos ston to //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis kyang chos ston to //
translated: The monks also taught the Dharma.

original: phyis kyang de kho na bzhin du dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis yon bshad pa dang / khyim bdag de rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug ste smras pa /
analyzed: phyis kyang de kho na bzhin du dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis yon bshad pa dang / khyim bdag de rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug ste smras pa /
translated: and the householder sat at the end of the row of elders and said,

analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag gis gtsug lag khang 'di bdag nyid kyi slad du yang bgyid du ma stsal /
translated: “Noble ones, I did not have this temple built for myself,

original: nye du rnams kyi slad du yang bgyid du ma stsal kyi /
analyzed: nye du rnams kyi slad du yang bgyid du ma stsal kyi /
translated: nor did I have it built for my relatives.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa rnams kyi slad du bgyid du stsal pa lags kyis 'di nyid du dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes shig dang / bdag gis 'phags pa rnams la yo byad thams cad kyis mi brel bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa rnams kyi slad du bgyid du stsal pa lags kyis 'di nyid du dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes shig dang / bdag gis 'phags pa rnams la yo byad thams cad kyis mi brel bar bgyi'o //
translated: I had it built for you noble ones, so please accept the invitation to stay here for the rainy season, and I will provide you with all the requisites.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,

original: khyim bdag gnyan yod na bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rje mngon sum du bzhugs shing /
analyzed: khyim bdag gnyan yod na bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rje mngon sum du bzhugs shing /
translated: “Householder, the Blessed One, the Lord of Dharma, is present in full view in Śrāvastī,

original: dus dang dus su dge slong che ge mo zhig gis ni dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: dus dang dus su dge slong che ge mo zhig gis ni dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byas /
translated: and from time to time a certain monk has manifested arhatship.

original: che ge mo zhig gis ni mi sdug pa'i bar grub bo zhes shes pa brda sprod pa dag kyang thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: che ge mo zhig gis ni mi sdug pa'i bar grub bo zhes shes pa brda sprod pa dag kyang thos par 'gyur /
translated: We have heard the grammarians say that the word “ārya” is derived from the root “ar,” which means “to go,” and the suffix “ya,” which means “to go to that.”

original: rgyal po yang bstan pa la shin tu dad /
analyzed: rgyal po yang bstan pa la shin tu dad /
translated: The king has great faith in the teachings.

original: btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang rgyal rigs dbyar tshul ma dang / bla mkhyen drang srong byin dang / rnying pa dang / dge bsnyen ma sa ga dang / ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma dang / gzhan yang dad pa can mang du yod pas /🔽der zang @217a *//
analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang rgyal rigs dbyar tshul ma dang / bla mkhyen drang srong byin dang / rnying pa dang / dge bsnyen ma sa ga dang / ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma dang / gzhan yang dad pa can mang du yod pas / der zang @217a *//
translated: There is also Queen Mallikā, the brahmin lady Vāsitthī, the sage Bhāradvāja, the householder Upāli, the laywoman devotee Viśākhā, the mother of Rāhula, and many other faithful people.

original: zing gi longs spyod dang / chos kyi longs spyod chen po yang 'grub pas bdag cag de nyid du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: zing gi longs spyod dang / chos kyi longs spyod chen po yang 'grub pas bdag cag de nyid du 'dong ngo //
translated: There we will find great enjoyment of material things and great enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa dag chos kyi longs spyod ni 'phags pa bdag nyid la rag las pa lags kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag chos kyi longs spyod ni 'phags pa bdag nyid la rag las pa lags kyi /
translated: “Noble ones, the enjoyment of the Dharma depends on the noble ones themselves,🔽but the enjoyment of material things depends on me.

original: zang zing gi longs spyod ni bdag la rag las pa lags pas dgyes pa skyed cig dang / cung zad kyang nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod ni bdag la rag las pa lags pas dgyes pa skyed cig dang / cung zad kyang nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: So be happy, and you will not lose anything.”

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis smras pa /
translated: The elder of the saṅgha said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dad pa can gyi dad pa spel bar bya zhing sbyin bdag la rjes su snying brtse bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das kyis dad pa can gyi dad pa spel bar bya zhing sbyin bdag la rjes su snying brtse bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: “Venerables, the Blessed One has said, ‘Increase the faith of the faithful and have compassion for the benefactors.’

original: 'di nyid du 'khod par bya'o zhes de dag der 'khod nas /
analyzed: 'di nyid du 'khod par bya'o zhes de dag der 'khod nas /
translated: So let us stay right here.”

original: blo brtan pas gtsug lag khang de'i phyi nang bcas par so sor brtag par brtsams pa dang / gtsug lag khang de me tog phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa shin tu dga' ba mthong nas /
analyzed: blo brtan pas gtsug lag khang de'i phyi nang bcas par so sor brtag par brtsams pa dang / gtsug lag khang de me tog phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa shin tu dga' ba mthong nas /
translated: When they had settled in, Sthiramati began to examine the temple inside and out, and he saw that it was filled with abundant flowers and abundant fruits and was very pleasant.

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis smras pa /
translated: The elder of the saṅgha said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag gtsug lag khang 'di me tog phun sum tshogs pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag gtsug lag khang 'di me tog phun sum tshogs pa /
translated: “Venerables, this temple is filled with abundant flowers

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa shin tu dga' ba yin pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa shin tu dga' ba yin pas /
translated: and abundant fruits and is very pleasant.

original: gal te bdag cag gis 'dir dbyar snga ma gnas par khas blangs na me tog dang 'bras bu thams cad yongs su longs spyad par mi 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: gal te bdag cag gis 'dir dbyar snga ma gnas par khas blangs na me tog dang 'bras bu thams cad yongs su longs spyad par mi 'gyur gyis /
translated: If we agree to stay here for the earlier rains, we won’t be able to enjoy all the flowers and fruits.

original: bdag cag gis nges par dbyar phyi ma gnas par khas blang bar bya'o zhes de dag gis der dbyar phyi ma gnas par khas blangs so //
analyzed: bdag cag gis nges par dbyar phyi ma gnas par khas blang bar bya'o zhes de dag gis der dbyar phyi ma gnas par khas blangs so //
translated: We should definitely agree to stay for the later rains.”

original: khyim bdag de la gtsug lag khang de gcig pu 'ba' zhig yod pas de sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang de nyid du sbyin zhing byed do //
analyzed: khyim bdag de la gtsug lag khang de gcig pu 'ba' zhig yod pas de sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang de nyid du sbyin zhing byed do //
translated: Since that householder had only that monastery, whatever he thought to give or do, he gave and did all of it in that very monastery.

original: ri brags @217b de na yang gtsug lag khang gzhan med pas ri brags pa de dag kyang sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang de nyid du sbyin zhing byed do //
analyzed: ri brags @217b de na yang gtsug lag khang gzhan med pas ri brags pa de dag kyang sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang de nyid du sbyin zhing byed do //
translated: Since there was no other monastery in that mountain village, whatever the villagers thought to give or do, they gave and did all of it in that very monastery.

original: ri brags de'i nye 'khor na yang gtsug lag khang gzhan med pas /
analyzed: ri brags de'i nye 'khor na yang gtsug lag khang gzhan med pas /
translated: Since there was no other monastery in the vicinity of that mountain village,

original: ri brags kyi nye 'khor ba de dag kyang sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad gtsug lag khang de nyid du sbyin zhing byed pas /
analyzed: ri brags kyi nye 'khor ba de dag kyang sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad gtsug lag khang de nyid du sbyin zhing byed pas /
translated: The people of the surrounding villages, who had been thinking of making offerings and doing service, all did so in that very monastery.

original: der dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong rnams la rnyed pa mang po byung ngo //
analyzed: der dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong rnams la rnyed pa mang po byung ngo //
translated: So the monks who had agreed to stay there during the rainy season received many offerings.

original: ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gi kun tu spyod pa ni /🔽dgag dbye byas ma thag tu 'dus te bdag cag gis las ci zhig byas na /
analyzed: ston zla tha chung gi g-yon can dag gi kun tu spyod pa ni / dgag dbye byas ma thag tu 'dus te bdag cag gis las ci zhig byas na /
translated: In the last autumn month, the rogues had a custom🔽of gathering together immediately after the lifting of restrictions and discussing among themselves, “What work should we do

original: des brtsal mi dgos par lo skor du longs spyod cing bde bar 'khod par 'gyur zhes phan tshun gros byed do //
analyzed: des brtsal mi dgos par lo skor du longs spyod cing bde bar 'khod par 'gyur zhes phan tshun gros byed do //
translated: so that we can live comfortably for a year without having to try?”

original: de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They thought,

original: sh'akya'i sras kyi dge sbyong 'di dag gzhom par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras kyi dge sbyong 'di dag gzhom par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: “We should destroy these ascetics, the sons of the Śākya.”

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others said,

original: de dag ni sgo 'phar brgya snyed bzla ba byas kyang lto khengs pa 'grub par dka' bas de dag la ci yang med na /
analyzed: de dag ni sgo 'phar brgya snyed bzla ba byas kyang lto khengs pa 'grub par dka' bas de dag la ci yang med na /
translated: “It’s hard to fill their stomachs even if we break a hundred locks. They have nothing.

original: bdag cag ci'i phyir yul de srid du bsdad par bya /
analyzed: bdag cag ci'i phyir yul de srid du bsdad par bya /
translated: Why should we stay in this country any longer?”

original: de na dge slong gi rgyus shes pa gcig 'dug pas smras pa /
analyzed: de na dge slong gi rgyus shes pa gcig 'dug pas smras pa /
translated: One of the monks who knew the facts said,

original: khyed ci shes /
analyzed: khyed ci shes /
translated: “What do you know?”

original: de dag la mang du yod do //
analyzed: de dag la mang du yod do //
translated: “There are many of them.”

original: ji ltar re zhig gtsug lag khang 'di gang gi yin pa khyim bdag de ni dad can bzang ba dge ba'i bsam pa can yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar re zhig gtsug lag khang 'di gang gi yin pa khyim bdag de ni dad can bzang ba dge ba'i bsam pa can yin la /
translated: “For one thing, the householder who owns this monastery is a faithful, good man with virtuous intentions.

original: khyim bdag de la yang gtsug lag khang 'di gcig pu 'ba' zhig yod pas /
analyzed: khyim bdag de la yang gtsug lag khang 'di gcig pu 'ba' zhig yod pas /
translated: And that householder has only this one monastery.

original: de sbyin pa dang / bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang 'di nyid du sbyin zhing byed do //
analyzed: de sbyin pa dang / bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang 'di nyid du sbyin zhing byed do //
translated: Whatever he thinks to give and do, he gives and does all of it in this monastery.

original: ri brags 'di na yang gtsug @218a *//
analyzed: ri brags 'di na yang gtsug @218a *//
translated: And in this mountain town there is no other monastery.

original: lag khang gzhan med pas ri brags pa 'di dag kyang sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang 'di nyid du sbyin zhing byed do //
analyzed: lag khang gzhan med pas ri brags pa 'di dag kyang sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang 'di nyid du sbyin zhing byed do //
translated: Whatever the people of this mountain town think to give and do, they give and do all of it in this monastery.

original: ri brags 'di'i nye 'khor na yang gtsug lag khang gzhan med pas /
analyzed: ri brags 'di'i nye 'khor na yang gtsug lag khang gzhan med pas /
translated: And in the vicinity of this mountain town there is no other monastery.

original: ri brags kyi nye 'khor ba 'di dag kyang sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang 'di nyid du sbyin zhing byed pas /
analyzed: ri brags kyi nye 'khor ba 'di dag kyang sbyin pa dang bya bar sems pa gang yin pa de thams cad gtsug lag khang 'di nyid du sbyin zhing byed pas /
translated: All those who think to give and do good deeds in this vicinity of the mountain hermitage, they give and do good deeds right here in this monastery.

original: 'dir dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong rnams la rnyed pa mang po byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i dge slong rnams la rnyed pa mang po byung ngo //
translated: The monks who have taken up residence here for the rainy season have received many offerings.

original: gal te yid mi ches na song la ltos shig dang rang nyid kyi mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yid mi ches na song la ltos shig dang rang nyid kyi mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you don't believe me, go and see for yourself. You will see with your own eyes.

original: gal te de lta na khyod nyid je song la mngon sum du gyis shig dang / kho bo cag phyis 'ong ngo //
analyzed: gal te de lta na khyod nyid je song la mngon sum du gyis shig dang / kho bo cag phyis 'ong ngo //
translated: If that is so, then you go and see for yourself. We will come later.

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: legs kyis de bzhin gyis shig dang / kho bo 'gro'o zhes des gos tshags bcos te /
analyzed: legs kyis de bzhin gyis shig dang / kho bo 'gro'o zhes des gos tshags bcos te /
translated: Very well, then. I will go. He adjusted his robes,

original: 'phags shing de nas tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis mchod rten la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: 'phags shing de nas tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis mchod rten la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: and with a verse of praise, he bowed to the stūpa

original: gtsug lag khang der zhugs so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang der zhugs so //
translated: and entered the monastery.

original: ji tsam na sgo khang na rgan zhugs shig 'dug nas g-yon can de de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te dri bar brtsams pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na sgo khang na rgan zhugs shig 'dug nas g-yon can de de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te dri bar brtsams pa /
translated: At that time, an old man was sitting in the gateway. The rogue prostrated at his feet and asked,

original: 'phags pa gtsug lag khang snying dang mig 'phrog pa mtho ris kyi them skas su gyur pa 'di su'i lags /
analyzed: 'phags pa gtsug lag khang snying dang mig 'phrog pa mtho ris kyi them skas su gyur pa 'di su'i lags /
translated: “Noble one, whose is this monastery that steals the heart and eyes, the staircase to the higher realms?”

original: bzhin bzang khyim bdag che ge mo zhig gi yin no //
analyzed: bzhin bzang khyim bdag che ge mo zhig gi yin no //
translated: “Good man, it belongs to a certain householder.”

original: 'phags pa ci 'di gtsug lag khang lags sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa ci 'di gtsug lag khang lags sam /
translated: “Noble one, is this a monastery?

original: 'on te phongs pa lags /
analyzed: 'on te phongs pa lags /
translated: Or is it a poorhouse?”

original: bzhin bzang gtsug lag khang ni ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: bzhin bzang gtsug lag khang ni ji lta bu yin /
translated: “Good man, what is a monastery like?

original: phongs pa ni ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: phongs pa ni ji lta bu yin /
translated: And what is a poorhouse like?”

original: 'phags pa @218b gang na yo byad phun sum tshogs pa ni gtsug lag khang lags so //
analyzed: 'phags pa @218b gang na yo byad phun sum tshogs pa ni gtsug lag khang lags so //
translated: “Noble one, a monastery is where there is an abundance of necessities.

original: gang na yo byad ma mchis pa ni phongs pa lags so //
analyzed: gang na yo byad ma mchis pa ni phongs pa lags so //
translated: A poorhouse is where there are no necessities.”

original: bzhin bzang 'o na 'di ni gtsug lag khang yin gyi /
analyzed: bzhin bzang 'o na 'di ni gtsug lag khang yin gyi /
translated: “Good man, this is a monastery.

original: phongs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phongs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a poorhouse.

original: 'di na yo byad phun sum tshogs pa yod kyi /
analyzed: 'di na yo byad phun sum tshogs pa yod kyi /
translated: Here there is an abundance of necessities.

original: 'di na yo byad med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di na yo byad med pa ma yin no //
translated: Here there are no lacking necessities.”

original: 'phags pa zas za ba ni 'ga' yang sa rdul mi za la /
analyzed: 'phags pa zas za ba ni 'ga' yang sa rdul mi za la /
translated: But no one who eats the food of the noble ones eats dirt.🔽And no one who wears the clothes of the noble ones wears tree bark.

original: gos dag gyon pa ni 'ga' yang shing shun dag mi gyon pas khyed cag la gos cung zad mchis sam /
analyzed: gos dag gyon pa ni 'ga' yang shing shun dag mi gyon pas khyed cag la gos cung zad mchis sam /
translated: So do you have any clothes at all?”

original: rgan zhugs de drang ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas /🔽des g-yon can de'i lag nas bzung ste gnas khang du bcug nas smras pa /
analyzed: rgan zhugs de drang ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas / des g-yon can de'i lag nas bzung ste gnas khang du bcug nas smras pa /
translated: The elder was honest by nature.

original: bzhin bzang gos kyi gdang gos dag gis phur shog cing 'dug pa la ltos /
analyzed: bzhin bzang gos kyi gdang gos dag gis phur shog cing 'dug pa la ltos /
translated: He took the hand of the deceitful man and led him to his room, saying, “Good man, look at the clothes hanging on the clothesline.”

original: 'phags pa ci 'di khyod kyi lags sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa ci 'di khyod kyi lags sam /
translated: “Noble one, are these yours?”

original: 'on te dge 'dun gyi lags /
analyzed: 'on te dge 'dun gyi lags /
translated: “Or are they the Saṅgha’s?”

original: bzhin bzang 'di kho bo gang zag gi yin no //
analyzed: bzhin bzang 'di kho bo gang zag gi yin no //
translated: “Good man, these are mine.”

original: 'phags pa 'o na khyod ni gor ma bkum par dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan nam chos sgrog pa zhig lags so //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'o na khyod ni gor ma bkum par dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan nam chos sgrog pa zhig lags so //
translated: “Noble one, you must be the Saṅgha’s elder or a teacher of the Dharma.”

original: bzhin bzang kho bo ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan yang ma yin la chos sgrog pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bzhin bzang kho bo ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan yang ma yin la chos sgrog pa yang ma yin te /
translated: “Good man, I am neither the Saṅgha’s elder nor a teacher of the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar kho bo ni dge 'dun gsar bu dge tshul zhig yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo ni dge 'dun gsar bu dge tshul zhig yin no //
translated: I am a young monk, a novice in the Saṅgha.”

original: 'phags pa de ni mjal na 'di na dge 'dun gyi gnas mal cung zad mchis sam /
analyzed: 'phags pa de ni mjal na 'di na dge 'dun gyi gnas mal cung zad mchis sam /
translated: “Noble one, if I meet him, is there a little lodging for the Saṅgha here?”

original: bzhin bzang mang du yod de /
analyzed: bzhin bzang mang du yod de /
translated: “Good sir, there is a lot.”

original: re zhig kho bo'i byug ris su yang dngos po bdun po dag 'thob bo //
analyzed: re zhig kho bo'i byug ris su yang dngos po bdun po dag 'thob bo //
translated: “For the time being, I will obtain the seven things.”

original: 'phags pa de yang mjal gyis 'di zhu'o //🔽gtsug lag khang 'di na gang la la 'tshal ma bgyid pa de ci rdza mkhan gyi snod du 'tshod dam /
analyzed: 'phags pa de yang mjal gyis 'di zhu'o // gtsug lag khang 'di na gang la la 'tshal ma bgyid pa de ci rdza mkhan gyi snod du 'tshod dam /
translated: “Noble one, I will meet him, so I ask this.”

original: 'on te zangs ma'i snod du 'tshod /
analyzed: 'on te zangs ma'i snod du 'tshod /
translated: “In this temple, whoever cooks, does he cook in the potter’s vessels or does he cook in copper vessels?”

original: @219a *// bzhin bzang khyod kyis gnas khang 'di dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: @219a *// bzhin bzang khyod kyis gnas khang 'di dag mthong ngam /
translated: “Good sir, have you seen these temple rooms?”

original: 'phags pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'phags pa mthong ngo //
translated: “Noble one, I have seen them.”

original: bzhin bzang gnas khang 'di zangs ma'i snod kyis gang zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: bzhin bzang gnas khang 'di zangs ma'i snod kyis gang zhing 'dug go /
translated: “Good sir, these temple rooms are filled with copper vessels.”🔽The rogue thought, “I have seduced her well. Now I will go.” The rogue said,

original: g-yon can des bsams pa legs par brid zin gyis da ni 'gro'o snyam nas g-yon can des smras pa /
analyzed: g-yon can des bsams pa legs par brid zin gyis da ni 'gro'o snyam nas g-yon can des smras pa /
translated: “Noble one, I will go.”

original: 'phags pa khyod kyi dge ba'i phyogs yongs su nyams pa ni bdag gi don yongs su nyams pa lags pas bdag slad kyis kyang mchi'i da ni mchi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa khyod kyi dge ba'i phyogs yongs su nyams pa ni bdag gi don yongs su nyams pa lags pas bdag slad kyis kyang mchi'i da ni mchi'o //
translated: “Noble one, your loss of virtue is a loss for me as well. I will come later. I am coming now.”

original: bzhin bzang de bzhin gyis shig /
analyzed: bzhin bzang de bzhin gyis shig /
translated: “Good man, do as you please.”

original: g-yon can des rgan zhugs de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te song nas /
analyzed: g-yon can des rgan zhugs de'i rkang pa la phyag 'tshal te song nas /
translated: The deceitful man bowed at the feet of the old man and left.

original: g-yon can de chom rkun pa de dag gi drung du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: g-yon can de chom rkun pa de dag gi drung du song ste smras pa /
translated: He went to the thieves and said,

original: pad ma'i mig can dag rdzas thams cad kyis gang ba'i gru bo che skams la 'dug gis phrogs shig phrogs shig /
analyzed: pad ma'i mig can dag rdzas thams cad kyis gang ba'i gru bo che skams la 'dug gis phrogs shig phrogs shig /
translated: “You who have lotus eyes, a large ship filled with all kinds of goods is on the shore. Steal it! Steal it!”

original: de nas gcig gis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas gcig gis smras pa /
translated: Then one of them said,

original: de na 'khod pa'i rab tu byung ba drug cu po dag ni 'phong gi slob dpon sha stag yin zhes grags pas /
analyzed: de na 'khod pa'i rab tu byung ba drug cu po dag ni 'phong gi slob dpon sha stag yin zhes grags pas /
translated: “It is well known that the sixty monks who are on it are all masters of archery.

original: de bzhin du gzhom par mi nus kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhom par mi nus kyis /
translated: We cannot defeat them.

original: gang gis tshe de dag mtshan mo chos nyan pa de'i tshe gzhom mo //
analyzed: gang gis tshe de dag mtshan mo chos nyan pa de'i tshe gzhom mo //
translated: We will defeat them when they are listening to the Dharma at night.”

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: The others said,🔽“Good!

original: nyi ma gang la de dag gi chos nyan pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nyi ma gang la de dag gi chos nyan pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: On what day will they hear the Dharma?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi la 'byung ste /
translated: “They will come on the eighth and fourteenth days of the month.

original: de la tshes brgyad ni thal zin pas /
analyzed: de la tshes brgyad ni thal zin pas /
translated: The eighth day has already passed.

original: tshes bcu bzhi la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshes bcu bzhi la 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will come on the fourteenth day.”

original: de dag sor mo dag gis nyi ma bgrang zhing 'khod 'khod nas /
analyzed: de dag sor mo dag gis nyi ma bgrang zhing 'khod 'khod nas /
translated: They sat there counting the days on their fingers.

original: ji tsam na tshes bcu bzhi la bab ste /
analyzed: ji tsam na tshes bcu bzhi la bab ste /
translated: When the fourteenth day arrived,

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis so sor thar pa'i mdo bton te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis so sor thar pa'i mdo bton te /
translated: the elder of the saṅgha recited the Prātimokṣa Sūtra.

original: dge 'dun gyi @219b gso sbyong byas nas /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi @219b gso sbyong byas nas /
translated: After the saṅgha had performed the poṣadha ceremony,

original: chos sgrog pa seng ge'i khri la 'dzegs te 'di skad ces /🔽mi mchog 'dul ba kha lo sgyur mdzad pa //
analyzed: chos sgrog pa seng ge'i khri la 'dzegs te 'di skad ces / mi mchog 'dul ba kha lo sgyur mdzad pa //
translated: the Dharma preacher climbed onto the lion throne and began to say,🔽“The Tathāgata, the supreme one among men, the charioteer,

original: kun sbyor 'ching ba gcod pa de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: kun sbyor 'ching ba gcod pa de bzhin gshegs //
translated: the one who cuts the bonds of all attachments,

original: dbang po zhi zhing nyer zhi zhi la mkhas //
analyzed: dbang po zhi zhing nyer zhi zhi la mkhas //
translated: the one who is skilled in the peaceful, the very peaceful, and the pacified senses,

original: mnyan yod bzhugs pa'i bka' bzhin byed la gsungs //
analyzed: mnyan yod bzhugs pa'i bka' bzhin byed la gsungs //
translated: has said this to those who follow the instructions of the one who resides in Śrāvastī.”

original: zhes smra bar brtsams pa dang / g-yon can de dag gis sgo brdungs so //
analyzed: zhes smra bar brtsams pa dang / g-yon can de dag gis sgo brdungs so //
translated: When he had begun to speak, the rogues knocked on the door.

original: dge slong de dag gis tshor nas smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis tshor nas smras pa /
translated: The monks felt it and said,

original: shes ldan dag khyed cag su yin /
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed cag su yin /
translated: “Sirs, who are you?”

original: 'phags pa dag bdag cag rigs kyi bu dag go /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag cag rigs kyi bu dag go /
translated: “Noble ones, we are sons of good families.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis bsams pa /
translated: The monks thought,

original: ri brags nas skye bo'i tshogs dag chos nyan du lhags gor ma chag gis sgo dbye'o snyam nas /
analyzed: ri brags nas skye bo'i tshogs dag chos nyan du lhags gor ma chag gis sgo dbye'o snyam nas /
translated: “There is no doubt that a crowd of people from the village has come to listen to the Dharma. We will open the door.”

original: de dag gis sgo phye ba dang de dag zhugs so //
analyzed: de dag gis sgo phye ba dang de dag zhugs so //
translated: They opened the door and they entered.

original: ji tsam na gzhom par brtsam pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na gzhom par brtsam pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: When they were about to be killed, the monks said,

original: shes ldan dag khyed cag na re /
analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed cag na re /
translated: “Sirs, you said,

original: bdag cag rigs kyi bu dag go zhes zer na /
analyzed: bdag cag rigs kyi bu dag go zhes zer na /
translated: ‘We are sons of good families.’

original: da nged cag 'joms par byed dam /
analyzed: da nged cag 'joms par byed dam /
translated: Now you are killing us.”

original: de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: 'phags pa dag bdag cag la ming gnyis te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag bdag cag la ming gnyis te /
translated: “Noble ones, we have two names.

original: slad rol du ni rigs kyi bu dag ces bgyi la /
analyzed: slad rol du ni rigs kyi bu dag ces bgyi la /
translated: Outwardly we are called sons of good families,

original: nang du ni chom rkun pa dag ces bgyi'o //
analyzed: nang du ni chom rkun pa dag ces bgyi'o //
translated: but inwardly we are called robbers.”

original: khyed cag ming 'dogs par byed pa ni nyams so //
analyzed: khyed cag ming 'dogs par byed pa ni nyams so //
translated: “You have lost your name-giving ability.”

original: g-yon can de dag gis dge slong dag bcom ste dong nas /
analyzed: g-yon can de dag gis dge slong dag bcom ste dong nas /
translated: The rogues beat up the monks and left.

original: dge slong bcom pa de dag gis gros byas pa /
analyzed: dge slong bcom pa de dag gis gros byas pa /
translated: The beaten monks discussed the matter:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das kyis lhag ma dang bcas par bzho bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas re zhig khyim bdag 'di phyogs bzhi'i dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin du bcug ste yang ci bya /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bcom ldan 'das kyis lhag ma dang bcas par bzho bar bya'o zhes gsungs pas re zhig khyim bdag 'di phyogs bzhi'i dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin du bcug ste yang ci bya /
translated: “Venerables, the Blessed One has said, ‘You should live with a remainder.’ So let’s make this householder give to the saṅgha of monks in the four directions. What else can we do?

original: bdag cag la sbyin du bcug ste yang ci byas /🔽bdag cag mnyan @220a *//
analyzed: bdag cag la sbyin du bcug ste yang ci byas / bdag cag mnyan @220a *//
translated: What else can we do?🔽Let’s go to Śrāvastī. There, each of us will not be in want of robes from our fellow practitioners.”

original: yod nyid du dong na der bdag cag re re la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis chos gos dag gis mi phongs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes gros byas so //
analyzed: yod nyid du dong na der bdag cag re re la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis chos gos dag gis mi phongs par byed par 'gyur ro zhes gros byas so //
translated: They discussed the matter.

original: ji ltar 'dong bar bya /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dong bar bya /
translated: “How should we go?”🔽“We’ll go by night, and by day we’ll hide in the forest.”

original: mtshan mo 'gebs pas 'dong zhing nyin mo thibs por zhugs te 'gro bar bya'o zhes de dag gis khyim bdag la yang ma bltas par dong ngo //
analyzed: mtshan mo 'gebs pas 'dong zhing nyin mo thibs por zhugs te 'gro bar bya'o zhes de dag gis khyim bdag la yang ma bltas par dong ngo //
translated: Without even looking at the householder, they left.

original: ji tsam na mthar gyis mnyan yod du phyin pa dang / dge slong dag nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par gnas pa de dag gis dge slong de dag sgren mor sgo'i gam yo na rgyu ba mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam na mthar gyis mnyan yod du phyin pa dang / dge slong dag nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par gnas pa de dag gis dge slong de dag sgren mor sgo'i gam yo na rgyu ba mthong nas smras pa /
translated: Eventually they arrived in Śrāvastī, where they saw the monks who were diligent in their practice of staying awake during the first and last periods of the night walking around naked in front of the gate.

original: gcer bu sgre byi dag khyed cag 'dir ci 'dod /
analyzed: gcer bu sgre byi dag khyed cag 'dir ci 'dod /
translated: “You naked, shameless ones, what do you want here?”

original: 'di khyed kyi gtsug lag khang ma yin la 'dug gnas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di khyed kyi gtsug lag khang ma yin la 'dug gnas kyang ma yin no //
translated: “This is not your monastery, nor is it your dwelling place.”

original: de dag gis smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: de dag gis smras pa tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: “Venerables,” they said,

original: bdag cag gcer bu dag ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag cag gcer bu dag ma yin no //
translated: “we are not naked.”

original: 'o na khyed su yin /
analyzed: 'o na khyed su yin /
translated: “Well then, who are you?”

original: dge slong dag go /
analyzed: dge slong dag go /
translated: “We are monks.”

original: 'di lta bu dag dge slong yin nam /
analyzed: 'di lta bu dag dge slong yin nam /
translated: “Are these monks?”

original: gang dag rkun po dag gis bcom pa de dag ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: gang dag rkun po dag gis bcom pa de dag ji lta bu yin /
translated: “What about those who were robbed by thieves?”

original: khyed cag ming ci /
analyzed: khyed cag ming ci /
translated: “What are your names?”

original: sangs rgyas 'tsho'o //🔽chos 'tsho'o // dge 'dun 'tsho'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'tsho'o // chos 'tsho'o // dge 'dun 'tsho'o //
translated: “Buddhajīva,”🔽“Dharmajīva,” and “Saṃghajīva.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'ongs pa legs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag 'ongs pa legs so //
translated: “Welcome, Venerables.”

original: 'ongs pa legs so zhes de dag gis sgo phye nas dge slong de dag 'jug tu bcug ste /
analyzed: 'ongs pa legs so zhes de dag gis sgo phye nas dge slong de dag 'jug tu bcug ste /
translated: “Welcome!” they said, opening the door and letting the monks in.

original: de dag la la las ni chos gos byin /🔽la las ni sham thabs byin /
analyzed: de dag la la las ni chos gos byin / la las ni sham thabs byin /
translated: Some of them gave the monks Dharma robes,🔽some gave them lower robes,

original: la las ni rngul zan  byin /🔽la las ni lhung bzed byin /
analyzed: la las ni rngul zan  byin / la las ni lhung bzed byin /
translated: some gave them sweat cloths,🔽some gave them alms bowls,

original: la las ni chu tshags byin te /
analyzed: la las ni chu tshags byin te /
translated: and some gave them water strainers.

original: bgo bsha' ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad bgo bsha' byas pa'i skabs de /
analyzed: bgo bsha' ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad bgo bsha' byas pa'i skabs de /
translated: When they had distributed everything according to the shares,

original: dge slong rnams @220b kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams @220b kyis bcom ldan 'das la gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the monks asked the Blessed One about it, and the Blessed One decreed,

original: mi shes pa la gtsug lag khang gi sgo gya tshom du dbye bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa la gtsug lag khang gi sgo gya tshom du dbye bar mi bya ste /
translated: “You should not open the door of the monastery to strangers.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig mtshan mo sgo 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig mtshan mo sgo 'dod na /
translated: If someone wants to enter at night,

original: de'i ming dang rus dri bar bya zhing gal te ngo shes na sgo dbye bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de'i ming dang rus dri bar bya zhing gal te ngo shes na sgo dbye bar bya zhing /
translated: you should ask his name and clan. If you recognize him, you should open the door for him.

original: ngo mi shes na sgo dbye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ngo mi shes na sgo dbye bar mi bya'o //
translated: If you do not recognize him, you should not open the door for him.

original: gzhan yang chos mnyan pa la bab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos mnyan pa la bab pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when it is time to listen to the Dharma,

original: dge slong mel tshe ba gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: dge slong mel tshe ba gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: A monk should be appointed as a watchman.

original: gal te chom rkun 'ongs na gand'i 'on cig /
analyzed: gal te chom rkun 'ongs na gand'i 'on cig /
translated: If thieves come, ring the alarm bell.

original: gand'i the'u 'on cig /
analyzed: gand'i the'u 'on cig /
translated: Ring the alarm bell.

original: dus kyi 'khor lo 'on cig /
analyzed: dus kyi 'khor lo 'on cig /
translated: Ring the wheel of time.

original: snam sbyar dang / bdun pa dang / lnga pa dang / gtur bu dang / rgya cang dang / shur bu dang / lcag po de dang / shur bu phre'u 'on cig ces tsham ngam bya'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar dang / bdun pa dang / lnga pa dang / gtur bu dang / rgya cang dang / shur bu dang / lcag po de dang / shur bu phre'u 'on cig ces tsham ngam bya'o //
translated: Ring the robe, the seventh, the fifth, the bag, the seal, the pouch, the whip, and the pouch for the whip.

original: gzhan yang ngas dge slong dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi kun tu spyod pa'i chos dag bca' bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngas dge slong dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyi kun tu spyod pa'i chos dag bca' bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, I will establish the rules for the conduct of the elder monk of the saṅgha.

original: dge slong dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis chos mnyan pa la bab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis chos mnyan pa la bab pa'i tshe /
translated: When it is the elder monk’s turn to listen to the Dharma,

original: dge skos la tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis gtsug lag khang gi sgo bcad dam /
analyzed: dge skos la tshe dang ldan pa khyod kyis gtsug lag khang gi sgo bcad dam /
translated: he should ask the monk in charge of practical matters, ‘Venerable, have you closed the doors of the temple?

original: so sor brtags sam /
analyzed: so sor brtags sam /
translated: Have you examined the monks?

original: chos smra ba la gsol ba btab bam /
analyzed: chos smra ba la gsol ba btab bam /
translated: Have you asked the Dharma teacher?

original: bshang ba dang gci ba'i skyabs byi dor byas sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bshang ba dang gci ba'i skyabs byi dor byas sam zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: Have you cleaned the latrines?’”

original: dge slong dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis kun tu spyod pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa dag yang dag par blangs te 'jug par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis kun tu spyod pa'i chos ji ltar bcas pa dag yang dag par blangs te 'jug par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk who is the most senior member of the saṅgha does not properly take up and follow the rules of training, he commits an offense.

original: de nas chom rkun pas bcom pa'i dge slong de dag la dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de nas chom rkun pas bcom pa'i dge slong de dag la dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks asked the monks who had been robbed by thieves,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bo cag gis khyed cag la bgo bsha' ji lta ba bzhin du bgo bsha' byas mod kyi 'on kyang da dung khyed cag chos gos @221a *//
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag kho bo cag gis khyed cag la bgo bsha' ji lta ba bzhin du bgo bsha' byas mod kyi 'on kyang da dung khyed cag chos gos @221a *//
translated: “Venerables, we have shared out the robes to you in accordance with the rule, but you are still short of robes.

original: dag gis brel gyis khyed cag khyim bdag gang gi gtsug lag khang du bcom par gyur pa'i khyim bdag de ni dad pa can bzang ba dge ba'i bsam pa can yin pas de nyid kyi gtsug lag khang du deng zhig dang / de nyid kyis khyed la chos gos dag gis mi brel bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dag gis brel gyis khyed cag khyim bdag gang gi gtsug lag khang du bcom par gyur pa'i khyim bdag de ni dad pa can bzang ba dge ba'i bsam pa can yin pas de nyid kyi gtsug lag khang du deng zhig dang / de nyid kyis khyed la chos gos dag gis mi brel bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The householder who owns the monastery where you were robbed is a faithful, good, and virtuous man. Go to his monastery, and he will make sure that you are not short of robes.”

original: dge slong de dag mtha' gcig tu dong ste /
analyzed: dge slong de dag mtha' gcig tu dong ste /
translated: The monks went to one side

original: phan tshun gros bya bar brtsams pa /
analyzed: phan tshun gros bya bar brtsams pa /
translated: They discussed the matter together.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshangs par mtshungs par spyod pa 'di dag zer ba ni bzang ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag tshangs par mtshungs par spyod pa 'di dag zer ba ni bzang ste /
translated: “Venerables, what the fellow practitioners said is good.

original: bdag cag gis khyim bdag la ma bltas par 'ongs pas yang phyir de nyid du dong na des bdag cag la chos gos dag gis bgo bsha' byed par 'gyur ba'i gnas kyang yod do zhes de dag yang phyir der dong ngo //
analyzed: bdag cag gis khyim bdag la ma bltas par 'ongs pas yang phyir de nyid du dong na des bdag cag la chos gos dag gis bgo bsha' byed par 'gyur ba'i gnas kyang yod do zhes de dag yang phyir der dong ngo //
translated: If we go back to the same place without looking at the householder, there is a possibility that he will divide up his robes among us.” They went back to the same place.

original: de nas khyim bdag des mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag des mthong nas smras pa /
translated: The householder saw them and asked,

original: 'phags pa dag ci'i slad du khyed kyis bdag la ma gzigs par bzhud /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag ci'i slad du khyed kyis bdag la ma gzigs par bzhud /
translated: “Noble ones, why did you leave without looking at me?”

original: dge slong de dag gis smras pa /🔽khyim bdag bcom ldan 'das kyis lhag ma dang bcas par bzho bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de dag gis smras pa / khyim bdag bcom ldan 'das kyis lhag ma dang bcas par bzho bar bya'o //
translated: The monks replied,🔽“Householder, the Blessed One has said, ‘You should leave with a remainder.’

original: zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Thus he sang.🔽🔽

original: des na bdag cag la blo byung ba re zhig khyim bdag 'di phyogs bzhi'i dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin du bcug ste yang ci bya /
analyzed: des na bdag cag la blo byung ba re zhig khyim bdag 'di phyogs bzhi'i dge slong gi dge 'dun la sbyin du bcug ste yang ci bya /
translated: “So we thought, ‘For now, let us get this householder to give to the saṅgha of monks from the four directions. What else can we do?’”

original: bdag cag la sbyin du bcug ste yang ci byas /
analyzed: bdag cag la sbyin du bcug ste yang ci byas /
translated: “What will we do with them?”

original: bdag cag mnyan yod du dong na der bdag cag la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis chos gos dag gis mi phongs par byed par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag cag mnyan yod du dong na der bdag cag la tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis chos gos dag gis mi phongs par byed par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: “If we go to Śrāvastī, there the fellow practitioners of the holy life will not let us go without Dharma robes.”

original: de'i phyir bdag cag mnyan yod du dong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag cag mnyan yod du dong ngo //
translated: “Therefore, let us go to Śrāvastī.”

original: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: 'phags pa dag gal te @221b bdag gi gtsug lag khang bcom pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag gal te @221b bdag gi gtsug lag khang bcom pas /
translated: “Noble ones, if you have destroyed my monastery,

original: ci khyim na bdag dbang ba'i rdzas dag kyang bcom snyam mam /
analyzed: ci khyim na bdag dbang ba'i rdzas dag kyang bcom snyam mam /
translated: do you also intend to destroy the wealth I own in my house?”

original: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gang gi slad du byon pa ni legs so zhes khyim bdag des yang rgya cher gus pa dang bcas pas mkhos su phab ste dge slong re re la yang yo byad bcu gsum bcu gsum phul lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag khyed cag gang gi slad du byon pa ni legs so zhes khyim bdag des yang rgya cher gus pa dang bcas pas mkhos su phab ste dge slong re re la yang yo byad bcu gsum bcu gsum phul lo //
translated: “Noble ones, it is good that you have come.” The householder then respectfully and extensively settled the matter and offered each monk thirteen sets of robes.

original: chom rkun pa de dag yang phyir 'ongs te gtsug lag khang gi sgo rdung bar byed pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis tshor nas de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: chom rkun pa de dag yang phyir 'ongs te gtsug lag khang gi sgo rdung bar byed pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis tshor nas de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The thieves returned and knocked on the door of the monastery.🔽The monks heard them and said,🔽“Venerable sirs, those rogues have come back. Make a commotion!”

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag g-yon can de dag nyid lhags kyis tsham ngam gyis shig ces /🔽gand'i 'on cig /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag g-yon can de dag nyid lhags kyis tsham ngam gyis shig ces / gand'i 'on cig /
translated: “Bring the ghaṇṭīs!”

original: gand'i'i the'u dang / dus kyi 'khor lo dang / snam sbyar dang / bdun pa dang / lnga pa dang / gtur bu dang / rgya cang dang / shur bu dang / lcag pod dang / shur bu phre'u 'on cig ces tsham ngam bya bar brtsams pa dang /
analyzed: gand'i'i the'u dang / dus kyi 'khor lo dang / snam sbyar dang / bdun pa dang / lnga pa dang / gtur bu dang / rgya cang dang / shur bu dang / lcag pod dang / shur bu phre'u 'on cig ces tsham ngam bya bar brtsams pa dang /
translated: “Bring the ghaṇṭī-bells, the Kālacakra, the saṃghāṭīs, the saptas, the pañcas, the mortars and pestles, the locks and keys, the bags, the whips, and the whips with tassels!”

analyzed: bus smras pa yab gal te de lta na bdag kyang rab tu 'byung ngo //

analyzed: bu legs so zhes des khye'u de khrid de rgyal byed kyi tshal du song nas /

translated: “Father, whatever slight defeat we have is due to our lack of learning. Please rise, and let us go to another country where we can study.”

translated: “Son, it is good. Let us go.” And the two of them went to another country.

analyzed: 'on kyang gzhon pa'i mtha' nyid nas las su bsko bas /

analyzed: yab mnyan yod na las su bsko ba mchis su lags kyang /

original: rgyal po yang bstan pa la shin tu dad cing /
analyzed: rgyal po yang bstan pa la shin tu dad cing /
translated: The king has great faith in the teachings,

original: btsun mo phreng ldan ma dang / rgyal rigs dbyar tshul ma dang / bla mkhyen drang srong byin dang / rnying pa dang / dge bsnyen ma sa ga dang / ri dvags 'dzin gyi ma dang / gzhan yang dad pa can mang du mchis pas de na zang zing gi longs spyod dang /🔽chos kyi longs spyod chen po yang mchis kyis der bzhud do //

original: @224a *// zhes smras nas /
analyzed: @224a *// zhes smras nas /

analyzed: de gnyis ci dgar ljongs su 'khod nas mnyan yod ga la ba der rgyu zhing dong ba na /

analyzed: mthar gyis rgyu zhing 'dong ba'i tshe /

analyzed: mnyan yod du phyir phyin to; ;ji tsam na rgyal byed kyi tshal dang nye bar phyin pa na gand'i yang brdungs nas bus smras pa /
translated: When he got close to Jetavana, he rang the bell and called out, “

analyzed: yang gtsug lag khang du gand'i brdungs kyis myur ba myur bar bzhud do //

analyzed: rgan zhugs des /
translated: The old man

original: bus bsams pa /

translated: The son thought,

analyzed: thabs 'di ni bzang po zhig yin gyis yang dbul bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: “This method is good. I will push him again.”

analyzed: nyi ma stong bas lhag pa'i 'od dang ldan pa /

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun tu bzang ba /🔽stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di nya dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / ma 'gags pa dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang /

translated: He was as beautiful as a mountain of jewels.🔽He was endowed with the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the three qualities unique to a buddha, and great compassion. He was surrounded by a great saṅgha of monks, including the great hearers such as Kauṇḍinya, Aśvajit, Mahānāman, Aniruddha, Śāriputra,

original: mo'u 'gal gyi bu dang / 'od srung dang / kun dga' bo dang / nam gru la sogs pa nyan thos chen po dag dang / gzhan yang dge slong gi dge 'dun mang pos bskor te /

analyzed: de yang ltad mo skyes te chu srin nya'i rigs blta ba'i phyir nye bar 'ongs so zhes zer ro // gang dag dad pa dang ldan pa de @232a *//

translated: “Sirs, the Blessed Buddha is free from curiosity.🔽The Blessed One must surely wish to teach the Dharma to a great crowd of people, beginning with the monster fish.

translated: “The Sage, free from curiosity,

original: ltad mo med la skye ngan don med smra //
analyzed: ltad mo med la skye ngan don med smra //

original: gzhan phan de la gzhol ba'i rgyal ba 'di //
analyzed: gzhan phan de la gzhol ba'i rgyal ba 'di //

analyzed: yab dang / yum dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / bla ma'i gnas lta bu dag la mngon par bzhengs pa mdzad mdzad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'khor de'i dbus su gshegs te /

analyzed: bzhugs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis nya pa lnga brgya po de dag la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: tshe phyi ma ni cir 'gyur /

translated: I will perform a miracle such that all these creatures—fish, turtles, frogs, alligators, and so on—will enter the river Mandākini just as they are, and the makaras will remember their previous lives and speak in human tongues.

analyzed: nga dang thabs cig smra bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'du bya'o snyam mo //
